loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Angelie has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages.

Angelie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Angelie hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap, and beverages.

loans.name: Rostico

texts.en:
Rostico is 60 years old, single and lives in the Philippines. 

Rostico has a beauty salon that provides manicures, pedicures, haircuts, hair rebonding, hair relaxing, hair coloring and hair cellophane. He has had this business for 37 years. He requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy items to use in his salon like nail polish, scissors, hair dryers, hair blowers and hair irons and also pay for the electricity for the services.

Rostico has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Rostico hopes to improve his business to provide for the education of his nephew and niece.

loans.use: to  purchase additional nail polish , hair colors, hair dryer/blower and hair irons

loans.name: Semeon

texts.en:
Semeon is married with seven children. Semeon is 47 years old.

Semeon has a bakery where he sells bread, rice cakes and other delicacies to earn a living. He has had this business for 15 years. Semeon has requested a loan to buy additional ingredients to make rice cakes, bread and other delicacies

Semeon has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Semeon hopes to improve his business for better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make rice cakes, bread and other delicacies.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is still running her business selling glassware, covers, tea sets, etc. This is Anahit’s second loan from Kiva and her tenth from Nor Horizon. She has never delayed her repayments. 

Anahit used her first Kiva loan to diversify her shop's assortment of inventory. After her previous Kiva loan, she was able to reconstruct her shop and to make it more comfortable for her customers. 

Now, Anahit is asking for a loan of 800.000 AMD, which she will spend to buy a large lot of souvenirs, vases and various glassware items for her shop.

loans.use: to buy dinner and tea services and sets of forks and knives for her shop.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.

Mary Grace has a shop that offers lamination, xerox copies, rush I.D and car insurance. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy tools for the maintenance of the machines and pay for the electricity for the services.

Mary Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy different colors of paint and pay for the maintenance of the zerox machine.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Marciana has a shop where she sells vegetables, seasonings, onions, ginger and garlic. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of vegetables like cabbages, squash, seasonings and bananas.

Marciana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marciana hopes to improve her business in order to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, vegetables and seasonings.

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en:
Pepita is 66 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Pepita has pigpen and she sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy animal feeds for the pigs like pollard, hog grower, hog starter and hog finisher.

Pepita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Pepita hopes to improve her business in order to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for pigs like pollard, hog grower and hog finisher.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 2 children. 

Eddie has a shop where he sells fish like sardines, milk fish, flying fish and dalagang bukid. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to buy stocks of fish to sell like sardines, milk fish and lapu-lapu.

Eddie has been a member of HSPFI for since 2010.  In the future, Eddie hopes to improve his business in order to pay for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell like sardines, milk fish and fying fish.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 29 years old, single and lives in the Philippines. He has a shop where he sells fish. He has had this business for 3 years. He has requested a loan for 20,000 to buy stocks of fish to sell like dalagang bukid, sardines, lapu-lapu and milk fish.

Henry has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011. In the future, Henry hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell like lapu-lapu, milk fish and sardines.

loans.name: Nacaria

texts.en:
Nacaria is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow with 5 children. 

Nacaria has a shop that sells vegetables. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of vegetables to sell like squash, carrots, cabbage, beans, "pechay" and potatoes.

Nacaria has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nacaria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell like beans, cabbage, carrots and squash

loans.name: Jurial

texts.en:
Jurial is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. 

Jurial is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy tools for maintenance like screwdrivers, T-wrenches, air compressor and pay for the gasoline for the services. Jurial has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  

In the future, Jurial hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Cresbee

texts.en:
Cresbee is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Cresbee has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages. Cresbee has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  

In the future, Cresbee hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 

Emilia has a shop that sells snacks like rice cake, suman and "Biko". She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients in making snacks like sugar, flour, cheese and margarine. Emilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.

In the future, Emilia hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making snacks like suman and biko

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
David tiene 30 años a pesar de ser muy joven ha logrado lo que muchos ansían, tener su propio negocio, es dueño del restaurante “RUSTICA”  en un año ha logrado consolidarse como uno de los mejores en la zona donde vive , fue su suegra quien la animo a iniciarse en ese rubro, es así que junto  su pareja salen adelante con la mira de seguir creciendo, empezaron preparando aproximadamente 30 platos de comida, en la actualidad están sobre 130 menús diarios algo que lo incentiva a seguir adelante, su negocio por las noches también funciona como bar, esto le permite un ingreso adicional; su trabajo es el principal ingreso para su sustento y para solventar gastos. familiares Lo que más quiere en adelante es seguir creciendo y tener otro restaurante en una mejor zona, también desea comprarse un carro;  el dinero de su préstamo lo usara para comprar productos al por mayor como arroz, azúcar y algunas bebidas. Por otro lado el grupo del cual forma parte se llama “AMIGAS UNIDAS” este es su tercer desembolso y están felices de continuar trabajando juntos.

•	David es el cuarto de la fila (paradas) está con gorra.
texts.en:
Although David is only 30 years old, he has achieved what others yearn for: he has his own restaurant called “RUSTICA”. In one year he has been able to establish himself as the owner of one of the best restaurants in the area he lives in. It was his mother-in-law who pushed him to pursue this endeavor and with his partner they are getting ahead, always with the vision to continue growing. They began offering 30 dishes and they are now offering over 130 dishes a day, which gives him incentive to continue going forward. As his restaurant is also a bar in the evenings, it generates additional income. His work is the principal income for his maintenance and the family expenses. What he wants most in the future is to open another restaurant in a better area and buy a car. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy wholesale products, like rice, sugar and some drinks. 
David is a member of the “AMIGAS UNIDAS” (UNITED FRIENDS) group. This is his 3rd loan and they are very happy to continue working together.
• David is the one standing in the corner against the wall with the baseball cap on.

loans.use: buy wholesale products for his restaurant, like rice, sugar and drinks.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
La señora Eduarda nació en Cusco, tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 5 hijos, y para ellos es que trabaja muy duro vendiendo comida en un puesto ambulante que tiene en una feria de la ciudad.

La señora Eduarda necesita de un préstamo para comprar artefactos eléctricos para implementar el negocio que hace tiempo está construyendo, que es poner su propio comercio de alimentos en su domicilio.

Eduarda pertenece al Banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.
texts.en:
Eduarda was born in Cusco. She is 52 years old, single, and has five children. They are why she works very hard selling food in a street cart that she has in a market in the city.

Eduarda needs a loan to buy electronic appliances to equip her business that she has been building for some time, which is installing her own food business in her home.

Eduarda belongs to the communal bank "Señor de los Temblores II" in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy electronic appliances to equip her business.

loans.name: Leang Sour's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager of the Mongkol Borei district, Leng Sour is a 37-year-old mother of two dependent children; one daughter and one son. She is a rice farmer of two hectare of farmland and she has been in this primary business for more than 10 years. She supplements her income by raising 8 pigs in her backyard of the house. Her main challenge is a lack of working capital for her business. 

Leng Sour is leading a group of three female members and she is a third cycled client with VisionFund. She successfully paid back the loans with VisionFund. The previous loans have helped her improve her living condition and she is able to earn daily income of up to 21,000 KHR from her business. Her group members are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 Khmer Riels each. As the leader, Leng Sour wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income so as to fulfill her dream of having a decent house for living in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 2 to 14 years. She describes herself to be an aggressive woman. She operates a food stall where she sells food and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a viable and marketable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals for selling. Her business goal is to run a wholesale bakery and snacks supplier.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has 2 children. 

Melina has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, for which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap & beverages.

Melina has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Melina hopes to improve her business in order to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow with 3 children. 

Tessie has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, detergents & beverages.

Tessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business for her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines.She is married and has four children. 

Carmelita has a pigpen, and she sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 21,000 to buy animal feed that includes hog grower, hog starter and hog finisher.

Carmelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009, and she hopes to improve her business so that she can provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy animal feed including hog grower, hog starter and hog finisher for her pigs.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en: Kristine is 21 years old, single and lives in the Philippines. Kristine has a shop that sells  cellphone accessories, like cellphone casing, cellphone protector, battery and  universal chargers, she also had a RTW's (ready-to-wear) products like slippers, shirts and more. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to buy stocks of cellphone accessories like casing, protector, battery , charger as well as  RTW's, like t-shirts, wallets and umbrellas and slippers. Kristine has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Kristine hopes to improve her business so she she can continue her study and could be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of  cellphone accessories ,like casing , cellphone protector and cellphone battery and universal charger and RTW products.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 57 years old, married and has children. Prima primarily grows rice crops to sell. She earns 6000 PHP per month doing this farming. Prima hopes to venture into other kinds of business to help augment her income.

Prima has requested this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She is hoping for an abundant harvest and increased income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has 2 children, ages 5 years and 8 years. He describes himself to be humble, charismatic and jovial. He operates a motorcycle and he provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located near a busy market and his primary customers are local residents. 

Samuel describes his biggest business challenge to be impassible routes in the busy market. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy motorbike spare parts. His business goal is to own several motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Erlinda has a shop where she sells rice, per kilo gram, and cooking oil. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy rice and cooking oil to sell.

Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business in order to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
63-year-old Rosita buys and sells fruits and vegetables to her community. She also provides prepaid mobile credit loads. Rosita earns about 5000 PHP per month with her retail business. She helps in buying her family's basic needs and hopes to earn better to make improvements to their standard of living.

Rosita has applied for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables and prepaid mobile credit loads to sell. She hopes for her business to grow and for her children to become successful.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables and prepaid mobile credit loads to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 31-year-old married woman who has 2 children, ages 12 and 8. Her husband works as a farmer.

Rowena has had a sari-sari store business for 3 years. She sells various items like coffee, sugar, vinegar, soap and shampoo. Each month, Rowena earns 5000 PHP per month with this business. She helps in providing for her family's basic needs and she sometimes cannot replenish her inventory rapidly.

Rowena is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries. She hopes for this loan to help increase her sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is a petty trader near Takoradi. She has done this for 1 year now. The items she sells are milk, milo, sugar, soups, tin tomatoes, tin fish,  biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc.. She is married and has 5 children. She uses her income to support the husband to pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Adjoa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase variety of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Ambako

texts.en:
Ambako is 46 years old. He lives in Khobi District, West Georgia with his family: wife, Bella and two daughters (15 and 13 years old). His children go to school.

Ambako and Bella are running a family agricultural business, which is the only source of the income for the family. In particular, they have 2 milk cows on a family owned dairy farm. Bella produces traditional West-Georgian cheese and sells it at the local open market. Also, the family has a 1.5 hectare piece of land where they grow maize, selling the harvest locally as well. 

Along with the above-mentioned, Ambako and Bella grow nut trees and they sell, on average, 500 kg nuts per year. Also Ambako is busy with bee-keeping. He has 5 bee-hives and sells harvested honey in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. 

Ambako has requested credit for purchasing an additional milk cow. With three milk cows, Bella will be able to produce and sell 50% more cheese. It will increase the income of the family and they will be able to purchase needed household goods, to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Maurice M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, is very pleased to present to you this group of primary school teachers from Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 9,400,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

Maurice is the leader of this group of teachers. Maurice was born in Yagala, a village near Kabala. He is sixty years old and married to a businesswoman. Maurice has five children who are attending primary and secondary schools. He has been a teacher for forty years. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials for the construction of a family dwelling.

loans.use: to buy house building materials for the construction of a family dwelling

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin  is a 47-year-old married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 15 years to 29 years. He describes himself to be social and talkative. He operates a restaurant  where he sells food, snacks and tea. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy commercial area  and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more food ingredients for preparing meals. His business goal is to expand his business  within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the anticipated profits in educating his children.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married woman. She describes herself to be honest and outgoing. She operates a retail store  where she sells items such as flour, sodas, sugar, bread, steel wire, and cooking oil. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a strategic business area  and her primary customers are residents and students from the nearby school. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy a "posho" mill. Her business goal is to run a well stocked grocery shop . She hopes that in the future, she will build a house.

loans.use: to buy a "posho" (grain-grinding) mill.

loans.name: Sumber Kelapa Group

texts.en:
After succeeding with the last loan, Hasunah and the member of Sumber Kelapa group decided to continue to borrow a loan from MUK with the same loan size. They need the new loan to improve their businesses.

Hasunah’s husband support her to run the bussines. He often help her to work on it. The bussines help the income of their family. Hasunah has a business making hand crafted from wood and coconut shells such as making ashtrays, tablecloths, and wedding gift. The loan is use to purchase  raws materials such as wood and coconuts shells.  Hasunah had a dream to renovation her house from the profits of her business.

loans.use: To purchase raws materials

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy sells bags of rice and operates a grocery shop near Takoradi. She has been operating this grocery shop for 5 years now. Some of the items in her grocery shop are milk, milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft  drinks, tin tomatoes, tin fish, etc.. Nancy is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a security officer. She uses her income to support the husband to pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Nancy  plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice and a variety of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Musa.  He is married and has 2 children aged 13 and 16 yrs.  In 2005, Musa established his provisions and drinks business. He began his business because he did not go to school and needed to be self-employed. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,100,000 every month from this business. 

Musa would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,500,000.  He has already received and successfully repaid his second loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy more drinks.  In the future, Musa plans to build his own house to live in with his family.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: Veer Angelo

texts.en:
Veer Angelo is 38 years old and is a married man with 3 children ages 12, 14 and 16. He manages a school canteen. He cooks the food that he sells in the canteen and he needs more cooking equipment. 

Veer Angelo earns 3000 PHP pet month with his business. He works hard to improve his income to meet his family's needs. He requested a loan to purchase ingredients and cooking equipment. Veer Angelo hopes for his business to grow and for his family to have a more stable standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and cooking equipment.

loans.name: Katia Zulianita

texts.es:
Katia es una joven muy entusiasta y trabajadora, tiene 30 años y junto a su esposo tienen 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 10 y 3 años, son su adoración y el motivo por el cual siempre ve con optimismo la vida y lucha cada día por darles lo mejor y sobre todo mucho amos; su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y con los ingresos que obtiene colabora en el hogar junto con Katia; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se encuentra en nuestra selva peruana y en la cual habita flora y fauna de gran variedad y sobre todo maravillosa. Cuando Katia tiene un tiempo libre le gusta jugar vóley con sus vecinas y amigas de su barrio y sobre todo cuando puede le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Farmacia; por ello ella trabaja muy duro para que sus hijos sean mejores que ella.

Día a día Katia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, refrescos; ella se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 5 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muy buena sazón y sus clientes se sienten a gusto es su negocio y por ello la recomiendan y siempre regresan.

Katia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mesas, sillas y una refrigeradora de segunda mano, con esta mejora podrá ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes y podrá tener una herramienta muy necesaria para su negocio, así ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” construir su vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en:
Katia is a very enthusiastic and hardworking young woman. She is 30 years old, and has two children, ages 10 and 3, with her husband. She adores them and they're her motive for always looking at life with optimism and she fights every day to give them the best, and above all a lot of love. Her husband works in masonry and with his income he contributes to the home together with Katia. Their house is located in the city of Pucallpa, which is found in our Peruvian jungle, where a great variety of flora and fauna live and which is, above all, marvelous.

When Katia has free time she likes to play volleyball with her neighbors and friends from the neighborhood. Above all, when she is able she loves to eat one of her favorite dishes, which is the very tasty "Arroz con Pollo" ("Rice with Chicken"). She only studied through high school, but she would have liked to study pharmacy. This is why she works very hard so that her children can be better than she is.

From day to day Katia works in her business selling food and soft drinks. She works for her business about 5 hours each day and can wait on up to 25 customers in a day. She believes that her business is going well because she has good seasoning and her customers feel at ease in her business and that's why they recommend it and always come back.

Katia is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have provided her she will be able to buy tables, chairs, and a second-hand refrigerator. With this improvement she'll be able to offer better service to her customers and she'll be able to have a very necessary tool for her business. In this way she'll be able to improve her earnings and keep on fighting every day to make her biggest dream a reality: to have her home built out of quality materials.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a trisikad business in the Philippines.

Lorena requested a PHP 11,000 loan, through NWTF, to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad transportation. She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad transportation.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy items like blouses, bags, shoes and computer supplies for her business.

Gladys has been in this business for two years. Gladys earns more income from a general store and internet cafe.

Gladys has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy tools, equipment, and other computer supplies.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven de 22 años de edad, soltero, nació en el Cusco y se dedica desde hace un buen tiempo al servicio de taxi. 
En esta oportunidad Edwin solicita un préstamo para hacer mejoras en su carro, necesita comprar repuestos para su vehículo y así prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Edwin desea comprar otro vehículo para alquilarlo y así incrementar sus ingresos. El pertenece al Banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.
texts.en:
Edwin is 22 years old and single. He was born in Cusco and has earned his living driving a taxi for a while now. Currently he is seeking a loan to make some repairs to his car. He needs to buy some spare parts and thus provide a better service to his customers.

Edwin wishes to buy another vehicle which he will rent out and increase his income this way. He belongs to the Señor de los Temblores II Community Bank in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Taufalaula

texts.en:
Taufalaula is a 52-year-old married woman with four children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Taufalaula has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, as well as pay her children's school fees. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Taufalaula hopes to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizer

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar es un joven d e20 años el cual vive junto a su esposa quien lo apoya siempre en todo lo que el realiza, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un, clima cálido en cualquier época del año así como también por su agricultura y por ser una ciudad donde sus pobladores son alegres y generosos. Como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país por ello uno de sus platillos favoritos es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”.

Todos los días Cesar se levanta con mucho ánimo para salir a trabajar en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi, trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque ofrece un buen servicio.

Cesar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar puertas delanteras y llantas para su vehículo, lo cual le permitirá tener un vehículo más seguro y brindarle más confianza a los clientes para utilizar sus servicios, así seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Cesar is a young, 20-year old who lives with his wife. His wife always supports him in what he does. He lives in the city of Ica; a city known for its warm climate at any time of the year, as well as its agriculture and its happy and generous inhabitants. Like all good Peruvians, he enjoys Peruvian cooking and one of his favorite dishes is “Lomo Saltado” (A stir-fry of marinated steak, French fries and vegetables served over rice).

Every day, Cesar wakes up inspired to go out and work as a moto taxi driver for about 12 hours a day, in which he can attend up to 30 clients a day. He believes his business is going well because he is very nice to his clients and he provides them with good service. 

Cesar is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help he will be able to buy front doors and tires for his vehicle, which will provide him with a safe vehicle and inspire confidence in his clients to use his services. That way, he can continue working to achieve his biggest dream: to own a house.

loans.use: buy front doors and tires for his moto taxi.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en:
Koreti is a 34-year-old married woman with six children.
 
She has a small vegetable garden and grows cucumber, cabbages and tomatoes. She has been doing this for one year. Koreti has requested a loan to start up a small market to sell her vegetables to earn a living. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Koreti hopes to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chicken manure, and insect poison

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae works hard to support 3 children. She is married and has a cellphone accessories retail business in the Philippines.

Ana Mae requested a PHP 4100 loan through NWTF to purchase of solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Ana Mae is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase of solar lamp.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. Lucia is married and has an herbal products retail business in the Philippines.

Lucia is borrowing PHP 4100 through NWTF to purchase of solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Lucia is aware that by using the solar lamp,she is saving money, she helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase of solar lamp.

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Elza is from a small village of Khobi District, West Georgia. She is married and lives with her family: husband – Zviad and three sons (17, 15 and 13 years old). All three children go to the local school. 

Elza and Zviad earn their living through the agricultural business. They have a dairy farm with 4 milk cows and 3 buffaloes. Elza produces cheese and sells, on average, 90 kg of this product at the local open market. Also, the family has 3 pigs on the pig farm. They sell, on average, 20 piglets per year. 

Zviad cultivates a 1.5 hectare piece of land, where he grows maize and sells it at the local open market as well. Elza and Zviad work hard in their farm. They spend most of their days on their farm. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris. 

Elza has requested credit for purchasing 2 additional milk cows. With 6 milk cows, she will be able to increase production and sales of cheese by 50%. With increased production, it will mean, on average, 300 Laris increase in their average monthly income. Elza plans to make some savings to renovate the house, as it is old and uncomfortable. After the renovation, the family will be able to have a well-deserved rest in a better environment.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 51 years old. He lives in a small village in the Khobi District, West Georgia. Gocha lives with the family of his brother: 47 year old brother, sister in law, 14 year old niece and 12 year old nephew. All adult family members are involved in the family's agricultural business, which is the main source of income for them. 

In particular, they have a dairy farm with 4 milk cow and 4 buffaloes. Gocha’s sister-in-law produces cheese and sells it at the local open market. Gocha is mainly busy with bee-keeping. He takes care of 15 bee-hives with bee-colonies. Gocha harvests honey twice a year and sells it in the village. Along with the above-mentioned the family has a 2 hectare piece of land, where maize is grown; family members sell harvested maize to local corn wholesalers. 

Gocha has requested credit for the cultivation of land. He will rent a tractor for tilling and to purchase fertilizers. After cultivation, they will sow maize and work hard till summer, to get a good harvest. As a result of this investment, the family will get planned income, which will be used for financing family living expenses.

loans.use: to rent a tractor for tilling the land and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is a farmer from a small village of Senaki District, West Georgia. He is a father of ten children and lives with his children and wife – Khatuna. The eldest child in the family is 18 years old and the youngest one is 7 years old. All ten children go to school. Khatuna is a housewife. Kvicha works hard in the family farm, which is the main source of the income for the family. In particular, they have three milk cows and a pig. Khvicha produces cheese and sells on average 50 kg of this product. Also the family sells on average 8 piglets per year. Although Khvicha works hard, the earned income still isn’t enough for normal living conditions for the family. The family is regarded to live under the poverty line and they receive relevant social assistance from the government. 

Khvicha requested credit for expansion of the cattle-shed building. In the future he plans to icrease the amount of milk cows in the farm, but he can’t as the existing building can’t place more than threee cows. Also part of the credit Khvicha will be used for cultivating the family owned plot of the land, where he will grow maize. Khvicha will use part of the maize for feeding the cows and the rest will be sold on local market. Sales of maize will be a new source of the income for the family. Khvicha plans to use the increased income for financing his children's high school education.

loans.use: to purchase construction material for cattle-shed expansion and renting a tractor for tilling the land.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en: Dali is 64 years old, single and lives in the Gardabani District of East Georgia. She lives alone and her main source of income is a dairy farm. She has two milk cows and uses them to make cheese. She sells an average of 35 kg of cheese to retailers who do business in her village. Her average monthly income is 300 Laris. Dali is requesting a loan to buy a new milk cow. With three milk cows, she will be able to increase her production and sales of cheese by 50 percent. This will mean an increase of about 150 Laris in her monthly income. Dali will use this increased income to buy household goods that she needs and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new a milk cow.

loans.name: Nhoeng's Group

texts.en:
Nhoeng is 42 years old, married, and a mother of five children. She lives with her husband and children in a village located in Mongkol Borei district. Nowadays, she still has four dependent children (two daughters and two sons) whom she needs to take care of. Rice farming is the primary source of income for her to feed the family but sometimes she works for others for pay. Nhoeng has been in this business for almost 17 years. Being a rural farmer, she has been challenged by low productivity of crop yield and lack of working capital for her business.

Nhoeng's group consists of two female members. Nhoeng has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles while Kimhun is just with VisionFund this loan cycle. The past loans have helped Nhoeng make her living better. Now she can earn up to KHR 20,000 per day from her current business.

 Nhoeng and her group member are applying for 600,000 Khmer Riels and 700,000 Khmer Riels with VisionFund, respectively. As the leader, Nhoeng is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and also spend some for land preparation for farming. She hopes to make more income so as to fulfill her dream of owning another hectare of farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica works hard to support 4 children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rica requested a PHP 4100 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend their business hours even after nigh fall.

Rica is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal “Todos Juntos”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Se dedica al rubro de corte y confección de ropa. Se desempeña en este oficio desde hace 28 años y desde hace 21 lo realiza de manera independiente.
Comenta que aprendió de manera autodidacta, ya que es un oficio heredado.
Luisa confecciona específicamente vestimenta para empresas y colegios. Trabaja directamente desde su hogar, ya que habilitó un taller en el patio de su casa, ahí cuenta con el apoyo de algunas maquinas de coser, entre las cuales se encuentran; overlock industrial, remalladora industrial, bordadora y colleretera eléctrica.
Su horario de trabajo lo distribuye dentro de la semana de acuerdo a la demanda de pedidos que realicen sus clientes. La temporada de más alta demanda del año es durante los meses de enero a abril.
Su mercadería la compra generalmente en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará chalecos de lana para colegio, de ésta manera Luisa pretende vender el uniforme completo de colegio, sumado a las confecciones que ella misma realiza. 
Una de las metas para su negocio es contratar una persona que le ayude a cortar las telas y moldes de sus confecciones.
Luisa vive junto a su marido, sus dos hijos de 25 y 21 años de edad, además junto a su hermano y un sobrino.
Unos de sus sueños es irse de vacaciones para descansar, pero lamentablemente no lo puede realizar ya que coinciden con el periodo más alto de ventas.
Ella está muy agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá contar con un capital, para invertir en su negocio. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones del Banco comunal, comenta le han permitido aprender nuevas estrategias de contabilidad y administración de sus ingresos. Por su parte el grupo del cual forma parte está muy comprometido con sus negocios y también la metodología de coavalidad.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Luisa is the president of the “Todos Juntos” (All Of Us Together) communal bank in the city of Viña del Mar.

She is a seamstress.  She has worked in this field for 28 years, and she has done this independently for 21 years.   She learned by teaching herself because she inherited this occupation.  Specifically, Luisa makes clothing for companies and schools.  She works directly from her home.   She equipped her shop on the patio of her house, where she has the help of some sewing machines.  Among the machines she has are an industrial overlock machine, an industrial stitching machine, an embroidery machine, and an electrical collar machine (a special machine used to make collars and cuffs).

Her work schedule during the week is established according to the orders that her customers make.  The season of the highest demand of the year is from January to April.  She usually buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago.

She will use the loan to buy wool vests for school.  This way Luisa aspires to sell the complete school uniform by adding the clothes that she makes herself.  One of the goals for her business is to hire another person to help her cut the fabrics and the patterns for the clothes she makes.

Luisa lives with her husband, her two children, ages 25 and 21, her brother, and a nephew.  One of her dreams is to go on vacation so that she can rest.  Unfortunately, she is not able to do that because that is the time when sales are the highest.

She is very grateful for the support from Fondo Esperanza.  The loan will allow her to have capital to invest in her business.  Regarding the trainings given at the communal bank meetings, she says they have allowed her to learn new strategies for book-keeping and managing her income.  The members of her communal bank are very committed to their businesses and to the practice of agreement.

Viña del Mar is a city and district located literally in the center of Chile.  It is known as the “Ciudad Jardín" (Garden City) because of the gardens and patios of some of the old houses in the city.  Also, it is considered to be the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: to buy wool vests for school.  This way Luisa aspires to sell the complete school uniform by adding the clothes that she makes herself.

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is 27 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for the family. Eda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell.

Eda has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, toothpaste, sugar, milk, etc. 

In the future Eda would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 35 years old. She lives in Gardabani District with her husband, Avtandil, and two little children. Avtandil is a shepherd and spends most of the time out of the house. Tamar is leading the agricultural business for the family. She runs a dairy farm with 3 milk cows and 5 calfs. Tamar produces cheese and sells, on average, 50 kg of this product, in the village, to dairy products retailers. Her monthly profit is, on average, 400 Laris. 

Tamar has requested credit for the expansion of the cattle-shed and for purchasing one additional milk cow. She will purchase construction materials and pay for the workers, who will expand the shed. Also, Tamar will purchase one new milk cow. She will make and sell more cheese. As a result of the above-mentioned investment, the monthly profit of the family will increase by 150 Laris. 

Tamar will use increased income for the well-being of her children and the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and to expand the cattle-shed.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 52 years old. He lives in Gardabani District, East Georgia with his family: wife, Nana, and 11 year old son, Luka. Luka goes to school. 

Tamaz works as an electrician in the village, but the main source of income for the family is still the agricultural business. The family runs a dairy farm with 3 milk cows and 3 calfs. Nana produces cheese and sells, on average, 50 kg of this product at the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. 

Tamaz has requested credit for purchasing construction materials to expand the cattle-shed. He plans to expand the dairy farm, but the existing shed can’t hold more than 3 milk cows. After expansion of the building, Tamaz will grow and not sell existing calves. In approximately 12 months, the family will already have 6 milk cows. They will be able to double production and sales of cheese and significantly increase the income of the family. It will allow them to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for expansion of the cattle-shed.

loans.name: Ma. Lowela

texts.en: Ma. Lowela is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to her customers. Ma. Lowela has been in this business for seven years and supplements her income by raising livestock. Her goal is to save money so that she can expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a 27-year-old married woman with three children. She plans to make and sell snacks, soft drinks and cooked food in her community to earn a living. She previously had one year of experience with this business. Veronica needs a loan to set up her business again. She plans to use her profits to build her family a new and better home. Veronica has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, snacks, noodles, ice pop wrappers, and soft drinks

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells peanuts in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanut to sell.

Juvy has been in this business for 20 years. Juvy earns more income from food vending and raising pigs.

Juvy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is 32 years old, married with 2 children who are in school.

Analisa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Analisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Analisa has been in this business for one year. In the future, Analisa would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 43 years old, a  married man who lives in Gaza with his wife, and he has 3 daughters and 5 sons.

Mohammad has owned a farm for the past 10 years; he has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products.  His dream is to enlarge his business. 

This has been a successful project, but his income doesn't always cover all his costs, so he asked Ryada for this loan to build an additional enclosure for his sheep. He will be able to increase his income and ensure economic stability for his family.

loans.use: to build an additional enclosure for his sheep.

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en: Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. A native of Kenema city, Aminata was born twenty-nine years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple have two children who are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. For twelve years now, Aminata has been selling fruits.  With the help of this loan, Aminata and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Aminata will use her share of the loan (800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL)) to expand her business by buying a large quantity of fruits to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fruits to add to her current stock

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail operates a grocery shop and this she has done for some years now. The items in her grocery are different kinds of soft drinks, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, tin milk and others. She is a single parent. She has 1 child. Abigail uses her income for the general upkeep of her child. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 34-year-old lady married to Amnon, a 40-year-old taxi driver. From the marriage, they are blessed with four children: Rey, 9 and Lens, 8 who are both attending Elementary school; Andar, 6 and Afan, 3.

Victoria is running a business selling clothes, handmade bags, belts and various accessories. She usually purchases the products from another island with a fairly cheap price and resells them to the customers with installment payment. Mostly her customers are college students and her neighbors. 

Victoria desires to buy more stock as demanded by the customer. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to do so. She used to belonng to the TLM group lending program. It was very helpful for Victoria in improving her business. Now she is requesting an individual loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. She would like to purchase more clothes and accessories to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
Jacinto es un hombre de 52 años de edad, casado con 03 hijos a cargo. Posee casa propia de material rustico, La cual es una zona rural, está ubicada en el Sector rama Cotona que, ubicada en el Caserío Chacupe Bajo que pertenece al distrito de La Victoria. Cuenta recientemente con servicio de  luz, y el agua que consumen es de pozo tubular. Los pobladores de caserío se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería, actividades artesanales.
La actividad a la que  se dedica Jacinto es al rubro de construcción civil y también a la agricultura. Tiene más de 13 años de experiencia en dichas actividades. Trabaja principalmente con maestros contratistas y también en forma independiente  en construcción de casas, colegios, edificios y otros. También su cónyuge se dedica a labores artesanales confeccionando sombreros de palma  y aporta con sus ingresos al presupuesto familiar. 
El monto solicitado del crédito es de 2500 nuevos soles y  será invertido en la  compra de eternits para techo de su vivienda y mantenimiento de 0.5  ha de camote y alfalfa, el cual le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida .
texts.en:
52-year old Jacinto is married and supports three children. He lives in his own simple house in a rural area called Rama Cotona located in the village of Chacupe Bajo in La Victoria district. Recently his house was hooked up to electricity; he gets water from a well. The local people earn their living from agriculture, raising livestock, or crafts.

Jacinto works in construction and also in agriculture, jobs he has had for more than thirteen years. He works mostly on contract for builders, but he also takes on independent work building houses, schools, and other kinds of construction. His wife makes hats from palm leaves and contributes to the household budget in this way.

Jacinto is seeking a loan of 2,500 soles to buy building materials for the roof of his house. He also wants to buy supplies for 0.5 hectares of sweet potatoes and alfalfa. The loan will help him increase his income and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the roof of his house and supplies for his fields

loans.name: Imanuel

texts.en:
Imanuel is a 44-year-old mason who is married to Tamar, a 45-year-old lady. They have been blessed with 4 children, namely: Lidiati, 20, graduated from High School; Armando, 17, attending 1st grade of Senior High School; Ronaldo, 10, who is attending the 5th grade of primary school; and Stevani, 8, attending 2nd grade of primary school.

In order to meet his family’s living expenses, Imanuel works as a mason. In addition to work as a mason, Imanuel also runs a piglet breeding business. He has been engaged in the business for 11 years. It takes 8 to 10 months to raise the piglet before selling it. Currently, Imanuel has 2 pigs ready to be sold.

Imanuel said that this business helps him in covering his family needs. That is the reason why he would like to enlarge the business. He would like to buy more piglets and feed for them and therefore he is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets and feed for them

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Unidas, es de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, con muchas ganas de salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo en conjunto ayudarse las unas a las otras. El grupo se encuentra en el ciclo número 11 del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
La Presidenta es Maria Luisa, una madre luchadora que tiene un pequeño negocio, que es una despensa. Es muy Activa y responsable y por sobre todo muy luchadora, ya que siempre lucha por darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, enlatadas, cárnicos, embutidos y demás insumos necesarios para poder abastecer su negocio y darle buena variedad a sus clientes
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank is from the city of Caaguazú.  They are very hard-working and enterprising women.  They have a great desire to get ahead by working together and helping each other.  The communal bank is in its 11th cycle in the Enterprising Women’s Program with the Fundación Paraguaya.

Maria Luisa is the president.  She is a tenacious mother who has a small business, a grocery store.  She is very active and responsible.  Above all, she is very tenacious.  She always fights to give her children the best.

She requested the loan to buy drinks, dairy products, canned goods, meat, sausages, and the other products needed to be able to stock her store and give her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, canned goods, meat, sausages, and other products.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in a rural area located in the Mongkol Borei district, Chantha is thirty-nine years old and married. She still has three dependent children, two daughters and a son, to take care of. She earns a living through farming rice and raising pigs. She has two pigs on the site. She has been in this business for fifteen years. As a farmer, she has been challenged with low crop yield which has made her encounter financial difficulty in making money for the family's living expenses. 

Chantha's group consists of three members, two female and one male. She has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles while her group members have been with VisionFund for from one to three years. She successfully repaid the loans with VisionFund. The past loans have enabled her to take her living standards to another level. Currently, she can earn up to KHR 24,000 per day. 

She is now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and buy feed for her pigs. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to build some savings to enlarge her farmland and also to buy a hand tractor for farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and feed for her pigs.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 31 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children in Gaza. In 2009, he opened a minimarket; he is requesting this loan to buy shelves, a glass door and a refrigerator. This will allow him to sell a wider variety of perishable and non-perishable goods for his customers. The glass door will improve the look of his shop and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy shelves, a glass door and a refrigerator for his store.

loans.name: Riana

texts.en:
Riana is a 38-year-old entrepreneur who is married and has been blessed with four children:  Andre, 16, is attending the first grade of Senior High school; Anggun, 12, is attending the first grade of Junior High School; Amalia, 8, is attending the fifth grade of Elementary school; and Fredo, who is two years old. 

In 2007, Riana initiated a kiosk business to support her husband in generating more income. She spent her own money to stock her business. Currently, Riana plans to sell soft drinks such ice tea, lemon tea, apple juice etc and to add more stock to her kiosk business. Therefore, Riana is seeking a loan of IDR 4.500,000 from TLM.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and other stock

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es una joven de 29 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos a los cuales junto con su esposo sacan adelante y son su razón de vivir, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se encuentra en nuestra selva peruana y en la cual habita flora y fauna de gran variedad y sobre todo maravillosa. Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platillos favoritos es el riquísimo “Ahumado de pescado”, debido a los pocos recursos de sus padres ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el sexto grado de educación primaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Costura.

 Luisa trabaja día a día  con mucho esmero en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, al cual se dedica alrededor de 6 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 30 clientes, ella cree que el va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Luisa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, menestras, entre otros, con lo cual tendrá mayor variedad de productos y podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño: “Tener un negocio mucho más grande y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia”.
texts.en:
Luisa is a 29-year-old mother of 3 children whom she and her husband provide for. They are her reason for living. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, which is in the Peruvian jungle where there is a large variety, and more importantly, beautiful, flora and fauna
As all good Peruvians, she enjoys typical Peruvian food and one of her favorite dishes is “Ahumado de Pescado” (smoked fish).
Her parents didn’t have the recourses for schooling and so she has a grade 6 education. She would have liked to study dressmaking

Luisa works hard at her grocery business in the daytime for about 6 hours a day and can attend up to 30 clients. She believes her business does well because she is very nice to her clients.

Luisa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business, like rice, sugar and vegetable soups, among other things; that way she’ll have a larger variety of products, she’ll improve her income and she can continue working to achieve her biggest dream: to have a bigger business and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: buy more items for her business, like rice, sugar and vegetable soups, among other things

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua produces fanti kenkey* for sale at Mbeam near Abura. She is a widow and has 10 dependents.  Akosua has done this for the past 4 years. She uses her income to feed her dependents and to pay her accomodation bills. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and firewood which she uses in producing her kenkey for sale. Akosua will produce in large quantities with her new profit.

*fermented corn dough wrapped in banana leaves -- often accompanied by fried fish

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and firewood which she uses in producing  her kenkey for sale

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi lives together with her husband, who is a farmer, and her 4 children at Mbeam, near Abura. Asi produces fanti kenkey for sale. Fanti kenkey is a local food, made out of maize. She has been in this business for 6 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their accommodation bills.  Asi will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and leaves to produce her kenkey for sale. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and leaves to produce kenkey for sale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells fanti kenkey and maize. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. They live together at Mbeam, near Abura. She has been selling kenkey and maize for 6 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills. Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize to sell. With the new profits, she will produce the kenkey she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells soap and doughnuts at Mbeam, near Abura, which she has done for 2 years now. She is a single parent and has 4 children. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay for her children’s school fees. Esi will use her loan to purchase bags of flour to produce the doughnuts and raw materials used to produce her soap for sale. With the new profits, she will produce in these items in large quantities.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre de un pequeño de 3 años de edad y al cual ama  muchísimo y es su razón de vivir y salir adelante día a día, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener unas hermosas playas, así como también por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de Arroz, considerado como uno de los mejores del  mundo; asimismo se practica la pesca artesanal, como fuente de trabajo para gran grupo de pobladores de la zona.

Día a día Luzmila se dedica a su negocio de venta de cervezas y bebidas gaseosas, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 70 clientes en el día en especial cuando son los fines de  semana; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismática y respetuosa con los clientes.

Luzmila está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a ala ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mesas, sillas y mas mercadería  como cervezas y gaseosas; lo que le permitirá brindar mayor comodidad para sus clientes y poder tener más variedad de productos, así podrá ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida para su hijo y poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a hard-working mother of a little 3 year old. She loves him very much and he is her reason for living and trying to get ahead day to day. Her house is in the city of Camana, known for its beautiful beaches and its farming, especially rice (considered one of the best in the world), and artisanal fishing, which provides employment to a great number of inhabitants of that region.

Every day, Luzmila works at her business. She sells beer and soda, about 10 hours a day and can attend up to 70 clients a day, especially on weekends. She believes her business is going well because she is very charismatic with and respectful to her clients. 

Luzmila is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, she will be able to buy tables and chairs and more merchandise, like beer and soda. That way, she can offer her clients a larger variety of products and more comfort, and in turn, she’ll be able to improve the quality of life of her family achieve her biggest dream: to have a bigger business.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs and merchandise for her business.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina”San Juan“están en el Décimo Cuarto Ciclo con 21  integrantes,  es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas. Comentan que se unieron con las ganas de poder ayudar a sus hijos y sacarles adelante.
Maria es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas, con lo cual puede tener los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia, y darles para el día a día. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, y su deseo es poder seguir creciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella y su grupo agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The 21-member San Juan group is in its tenth loan cycle. The members are well known in the neighbourhood for being committed and responsible people. They formed a group in order to be able to help their children get ahead.

Maria is one of the members. She sells all types of clothing; the income helps her support her family and provide for their daily needs. She says she is a hardworking, enterprising person whose wish is to continue making progress. 

Maria is seeking a loan to buy more clothing so that she will be able to offer her customers a greater variety. She and the other members of the group are grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the help they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Yayaa

texts.en: Yayaa sells maize and plantains at Mbem, near Abura. She has been in this business for 4 years now. She is a widow and has 4 children. She uses her income for the general up-keep of her children. Yayaa will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and plantains to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and plantains to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama lives together with her husband who is a farmer and three children at Mbem near Abura. Ama  produce fanti kenkey for sale. Fanti kenkey is a locally made food, made out of maize. She has been in this business for six years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their accomodation bills. Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and firewood to produce her kenkey for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and firewood to produce her kenkey for sale

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is a seamstress at Mbem near Abuar. She has been a seamstress for five years now. Akua is married with five children. She uses her income to help her husband to pay her accommodation and utility bills. Akua will use her loan to purchase fabric to make dresses for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make dresses for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells doughnuts at Mbeam near Abura, which she has done for some years now. She is a single parent and has one child. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, clothe, and to pay her child's school fees. Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil to prepare her doughnuts for sale. With the new profit, she will produce in large quantity.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil to prepare her  doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité "Kuña Katupyry"se originó a traves de promociones  que se realizo en el barrio. Todas son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio. El objetivo de cada de una es trabajar en forma conjunta, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa de comité de mujeres.
La sra Rufina, es Presidenta del grupo. Se dedica a la venta de chipa (alimento típico paraguayo), gracias a lo cual ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de harina de maíz, queso, huevos y demás insumos con lo cual podrá seguir haciendo las chipas que vende y generar los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Katupyry” group was formed after promotional brochures were circulated in the members’ neighborhood.  All of the members are from the same area, know each other, and are neighbors.  Each of the members has the goal of working together to encourage group solidarity and make the most of their communal bank.  

Rufina is the group’s president.  She makes a living selling chipas [Paraguayan cheese buns].  Her business has allowed her to help her family and provide them with what they need to improve their living conditions.

Rufina is asking for a loan to purchase corn flour, cheese, eggs, and the other ingredients she needs so she can continue making and selling chipas.  This will make it possible for her to generate the income she needs to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn flour, cheese, eggs, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua produce palm oil for sale. She has been into this business for four years now. She lives together with her husband and five children at Mbeam near Abura. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Efua will use her loan to purchase palm fruit and other ingredients she will use to produce her oil for sale. With the new profit, she will produce in large quantity

loans.use: purchase palm fruit and other ingredient she will use to produce her oil for sale

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 7 hijos. La actividad económica principal de Sofía es la venta de comida en uno de los mercados de la ciudad, actividad que realiza hace muchos años y que le ha dado mucha experiencia en el rubro de los alimentos.
La señora Sofía necesita mucho hacer un préstamo para poder implementar su negocio y así poder juntar dinero para poner su propio restaurante.
Sofía pertenece al Banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.
texts.en:
Sofia is 47 years old, married and has 7 children. Sofia's principal economic activity is selling meals in one of the city markets. She has been doing this for many years and has gained much experience in the food business. Sofia needs a loan very much to enhance her business and, thus, to be able to earn more money and install her own restaurant. 

Sofia belongs to the "Senor de los Temblores II" (Lord of the Earthquakes II) Communal Bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: buy furnishings and supplies for her business, including plates, glasses, and chairs.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: José , es de la comunidad la Laguna casado tiene dos hijos  de 15 Y  10 años  respectivamente que estudian .Don José empezó a trabajar en la siembra de frijol y maíz desde que tenía 12 años de edad  y a los veinte años que se caso decide trabajar independiente. Hoy la tierra que  posee partes fueron heredadas por el papa y parte que ha ido comprando con la ganancia de la cosecha José dice que  cuando saca la cosecha de frijol y maíz la lleva a vender a Managua ya que el mercado es grande, Las labores de siembra las realiza con ayuda de trabajador que vive en la misma comarca .José quiere este préstamo para comprar el abono y los insumos que va a utilizar en la siembra del frijol. Esta seguro que el crédito será de gran ayuda ya que podrá comprar todos los insumos a tiempo el  dice que una vez que saque la cosecha pagara el préstamo y la ganancia que le quede comprara material de construcción para mejorar la casa.
texts.en:
Jose is from the community of La Laguna.  He is married with children, ages 15 and 10, who are currently in school.  Jose has been farming beans and corn since he was 12 years old.  For the last twenty years, since he was married, he has been working independently.  

The land Jose owns today is inherited from his father as well as purchased with earnings from his past harvests.  Jose says that he brings his harvest of beans and corn to sell in Managua because the markets are larger.  He has help each planting season from local workers from his same area.  Jose will use this loan to buy fertilizer and the necessary supplies for the bean planting season.  He is sure that this loan will be a huge help because he will be able to purchase all of his supplies in time for planting season.  He says that after the harvest he will pay back the loan, and then use the profits to buy construction materials for home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and supplies for the upcoming bean planting season.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola lives in Compound #3.  She is 33 years old, married and has a 16-year-old child that lives at home and attends school.  

For many years, she has been running a shop where she sells rice, flour, soap, palm oil and other items.  She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, flour, soap, palm oil and other items for her business.  

In the future, she wants to educate her child and expand her business for her child.

loans.use: to buy more rice, flour, soap, palm oil and other items for her business.

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy luchadora Madre y Padre de sus 2 hijas a las cuales saca adelante sola ya que el padre de las niñas la abandono y desde entonces se esfuerza mucho cada día por verlas felices, asimismo vive al lado de sus padres los cuales son mayores de edad y ella los apoya mucho con el fruto de sus trabajo; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener las Islas Ballestas y el Candelabro de paracas, lugares turísticos que reciben infinidad de personas para apreciar su belleza y esplendor, también se le conoce por la amabilidad de su gente y por sus actividades principales como la pesca y la agricultura. Maria es una mujer mil oficios como llamamos en Perú, con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de venta de comida, se levanta muy temprano para cocinar los platillos que ofrece, en el transcurso atiende su negocio de bebidas, por las tardes se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos de belleza,  trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y atiende alrededor de 20 clientes, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque se organiza y porque atiende a sus clientes con cariño como si fueran de su familia y por ello le tienen aprecio.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio de bebidas ya que comprar gaseosas al por mayor y así mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijas”.
texts.en:
Maria is a very tenacious woman who acts as mother and father for her 2 daughters: she provides for them alone, as their father has abandoned them. Since then, she works very hard every day to make them happy. She also lives close to her elderly parents, and she helps them a lot with the fruits of her job. She lives in Pisco, a town renowned for the Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Candelabrum, two tourist attractions that many people visit in order to enjoy their beauty and splendor. The town is also renowned for the kindness of its inhabitants and for its main economic activities, fishing and agriculture. As we say here in Peru, Maria is a very busy woman, doing many jobs: with deep determination she engages in her food selling activity, waking up very early to cook the dishes she offers. At the same time she tends to her soft drinks shop, and at night she sells beauty products. She works around 10 hours a day and she has around 20 customers.
