Elsa is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman with two children aged ten and eleven. Her husband works as a carpenter and driver.

Elsa sells "puto" (rice cake), banana cue and other local delicacies. She also runs a small sari-sari store business where she sells canned goods, toiletries and other items. Elsa does her best to help sustain her family and her children's education. She has requested a loan to purchase sugar, cooking oil, flour and rice. This loan will help increase Elsa's sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil, flour and rice.

loans.name: Annabel's Group

texts.en: Annabel is married and has two school-aged children and 2 adult children. Annabel is 41 years old. For almost two years, Annabel has been a juice maker.  Annabel earns approximately 9,000 PHP every month. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase more fruits for her juice-making business. Annabel has been a member of PMPC for two years. Annabel hopes to earn more than 15,000 PHP after two more years.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits for her juice-making business

loans.name: Waldir

texts.es:
Waldir es un hombre de 25 años de edad, es soltero y sin hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa de sus padres la cual esta ubicada en el caserío Pedregal Bajo,  dedicado a la ganadería y al servicio de transporte.
La actividad que desarrolla Waldir es la crianza de animales menores y al transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, además cuenta con experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, su madre lo apoya en sus actividades que realiza.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 3000 nuevos soles y  será para la compra de alimentos para engorde de animales y realizar mantenimiento y compra de llantas de su mototaxi, lo cual le permitirá seguir creciendo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Waldir is a 25 year old single man with no children in his care.  He lives in his parents’ house located in Pedregal Bajo.  He works raising animals and providing transportation service.

The activity Waldir does is raising small farm animals and transporting passengers in his mototaxi.  He also relates that he has experience running his business; his mother helps him with his activities.

The amount of the loan requested is 3000 new soles that will be used to buy feed to fatten up his animals, to service his mototaxi and to buy tires for it that will make it possible for him to continue growing and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, to service his mototaxi and to buy tires for it.

loans.name: La Paz Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “La Paz ” están en el Décimo  Ciclo  con 17   integrantes, ellas son señora muy trabajadoras y con un gran espíritu de trabajo, su meta es ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma poder darle un mejor futuro a sus familias.
Pricilia es una de estas mujeres, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, en lo que le va muy bien, ya que sus comestibles son muy aceptados por sus cliente. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ansias de salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo ayudar a las demás personas que de ella dependen.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, condimentos, panificados, aderezos y demás insumos que necesite para poder seguir vendiendo sus productos.
texts.en:
The committee is called “La Paz” (Peace) and they are in the 10th cycle with 17 members.  They are very hard working women with a great work ethic.  Their goal is to help each other out and provide a better future for their families this way.

Pricilia is one of these women.  She sells all types of food and does well because her food is well received by her customers.  She is a very hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead and through her work help other people who depend on her.

She is asking for the loan to by meat, condiments, baked goods, sauces and other ingredients needed to continue selling her products.

loans.use: to buy meats, condiments, baked goods, sauces and other ingredients.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar es un hombre de 27  años de edad, vive junto a su esposa. Vive en casa propia, actualmente vive en el Caserío los Bances del distrito  de   Túcume y  cuenta con servicios de  luz y agua, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 80  familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Omar es la venta de animales y comercio de granos en la zona de Túcume y también se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio desde hace 03 años aproximadamente.
El monto del crédito  solicitado es de 2500 nuevos soles y será para invertir en la  compra de animales como  chivos y ovejas, compra de alimentos y también para incrementar un poco su capital para el comercio de granos.
texts.en:
Omar is a 27 year old man living with his wife in his own house in Caserío Los Bances in Túcume District; he has both electricity and water.  It is a small community with approximately 80 families.

Omar’s activity is selling animals and grains in the Túcume area and he also farms.  He has about 3 years’ experience in the business.

The amount of the requested loan is 2500 new soles that he will use to buy animals like goats and sheep and to buy animal feed and also to increase his capital a little for the grain sales.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman with eight children. Rita wants to support her husband in providing for their needs and sending their children to school. She cultivates her land and grows rice crops to sell. 

Rita needs funding for her farm. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Rita hopes to elevate her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita does farming for a living. She and her husband cultivate their land to grow rice crops to sell. Amelita does her best to keep their farm productive. She applied for a loan so they could fund their farm. She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizers and farm inputs. This will help increase their yield and income. Amelita hopes for her family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and farm inputs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is thirty-four years old. He lives in Tskaltubo District with his family: his wife – Sopiko, his nine-year-old daughter and six-year-old son as well as his retired father. The children go to local school. The only source of income for the family is a small-scale agricultural business. They have a milk cow and 200 nut trees on a family-owned plot of land. Sopiko produces cheese and sells it in the village. Nuts are sold in the village as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 270 Laris, including social assistance. According to the country’s government assessment they are regarded as living under the poverty line and receive relevant social assistance. 

David requested credit to start-up a business trading fruit and vegetables. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit David will start-up a trade business. He will purchase fruit and vegetables from local farmers at wholesale prices and take them in his own car to nearby towns for resale. As a result of the new business initiative the income of the family will significantly increase and the family will be able to improve their living conditions.  In addition to the above-mentioned in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila runs a sari-sari store business in San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman with two children. Cirila sells various items in her store such as spices, milk, coffee, toiletries and canned goods. She earns 9,000 PHP per month with her business. Cirila works hard to keep her business running so she can continue providing for her family's basic needs. 

She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as eggs and canned goods. This will help increase Cirila's sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as eggs and canned goods.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a sari-sari store business owner from San Miguel, Bohol. She sells daily use products like shampoo, soap, coffee, sugar and also snack food. Crispina also raises pigs to help augment her income. She works hard to support her family and improve their living conditions.

Crispina is requesting a loan to buy pig feed and more merchandise to sell. Crispina hopes for her ventures to prosper.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is thirty-one years old. She is a married woman with a five-year-old child. Her husband works as a farmer and "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) driver.

Elisa has been in the business of raising hogs for two years. She earns 10,000 PHP per month doing this business. She plans to use her loan to purchase additional piglets and feed. Elisa is hoping this loan will help to improve her business. She also hopes to elevate the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with ten children. She is 47 years old and lives in Katipunan, Guipos, ZDS.                                                                                                            

Josephine is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years. 

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for 3 years, and she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fertilizers for her farm. In the future, she hopes to improve her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Arcily

texts.en:
Arcily is 32 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. She is married without children. For the past year, Arcily has been running a store that sells a variety of products. 

Arcily has been a member of PMPC for two years, and she requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. In the future, Arcily hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a 44-year-old married woman with 6 children. She is involved in fishing. Her husband, who is a fisherman, goes out to catch fish. Evelyn sells her husband's catch at their town's market. She also dries fish to sell. Evelyn is working hard to achieve her dream of having her children finish college and become successful. She has applied for a loan to purchase fish nets and a fishing boat. This loan will help increase Evelyn's business profitability and hopefully she will be able to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and a fishing boat

loans.name: Naili

texts.en:
Naili is 62 years old. She lives in a small village of Telavi District with her husband, Ivane. Both Naili and Ivane are retired. Their monthly pension in the amount of 214 Laris per month is the only source of the income for the family. According to the Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable, poor category. 

Naili has requested credit for re-starting the family's agricultural business, which was stopped 3 years ago, because lack of recourse for financing the seasonal costs of the business. With the requested funds, Naili and Ivane will cultivate the family-owned plot of land and sow maize. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions for business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor population, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Naili will rent a tractor for tilling the land and purchase fertilizers and maize for sowing. Naili and Ivane will work hard on their plot of land during spring and summer to get a good harvest. They will sell harvested maize on the Telavi market. The family will get additional income and she will be able to improve family's living conditions. In addition to the above-mentioned, in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to rent a tractor for tilling the land, purchase fertilizers and maize for sowing.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a married woman who has two children, aged nine and 15 years.  She and her husband are both farmers.  Guillerma wakes up early in the morning to prepare food for her family and help work at the farm.  She helps cultivate their land and grows rice crops to sell.  

Guillerma has applied for a loan because she needs funding for their farm.  She plans to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.  In the future, Guillerma hopes to own a bigger farm with more land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other inputs for her farm.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 40 years old. He lives in Telavi District with his 9 year old daughter, Nina, his mother and his 36 year old brother. Along with Levan’s mother, his brother is the only income provider in the family. He works as an agricultural worker in the village and earns 150 Laris per month. The total average monthly income for the family is 250 Laris (Salary of Levan’s brother and pension of his mother). According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Levan has requested credit for re-starting an agricultural business, which was stopped 5 years ago because of lack of funding. Levan used to run a dairy farm. He had cows and the family was producing cheese and selling it. Now, Levan has requested credit for restarting the dairy farm. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions for business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor population, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Alex will start up the dairy farm. He will purchase 3 calfs and grow them. Calfs will be placed in an old cattle-shed, located in Levan’s yard. After a half year, he will start production of cheese and sell it on the local market to dairy products retailers. The income of the family will increase by 400 – 500 Laris, which will mean a 160 – 200% increase. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and, in addition to the above-mentioned, in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase calfs for the re-starting of a dairy farm.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 31 years old. He lives in a small village of Kakheti Region with his family, his wife Madina and three children (6, 5 and 2 years old). Madina is a housewife. She cares for her family. Tamaz is the only income provider for the family. He works as worker in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 200 Laris. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Tamaz has requested credit for re-starting an agricultural business, which was stopped 2 years ago, because of lack of funding. Tamaz used to trade with livestock. Now, he has requested credit for restarting the business. His loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions for business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor population, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Tamaz will purchase 8-9 calfs and grow them. Calfs will be placed in an old cattle-shed, located in Tamaz’s yard. After a half year, he will sell grown calfs for higher prices and get the profit. For the first 3 cycles, Tamaz will reinvest most of the profit into the business, to increase the turnover. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to combat the poverty. In addition to the above-mentioned, in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase calfs.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is a married woman who has two children. She is forty-five years old, residing at Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Alma used her last loan to pay for the cost of harvesting coconuts. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is forty-three years old. She is married with one grown-up child and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City, Philippines.

Victoria is a longanesa (a cooked dish) maker and she's been doing this for almost five years. She has an estimated income of PHP 10,000 every month which really helps her to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase meat and chicken for her longanesa business.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is from Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is forty-nine years old. Aurelia is married and has four children. To make a living, Aurelia owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. Aurelia has been engaged in her business for fourteen years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Aurelia joined GDMPC. Aurelia is requesting a loan of 4,500 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery es una mujer de 22 años de edad, conviviente y con 02 hijos, vive en casa propia ubicada en Caserío Huascar Distrito Tambogrande, ella vive en la parte rural  de este distrito.
La actividad que desarrolla la Mery es la crianza de ganado ovino, porcino, aves de corral, y  cuenta con experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, su conviviente lo apoya en sus actividades que realiza.
El  monto del crédito solicitado es de 2500 nuevos soles y lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales y además  realizar compra de ganado ovino y así seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mery is a 22 year old woman with a spouse and two children; she lives in her own house located in Caserío Huascar, Tambogrande District.  She lives in the rural part of this district.

The activity that Mery carries out is raising sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl.  She has experience running her business.  Her spouse helps her out in the activities she does.

The amount of the requested loan is 2500 new soles to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed to fatten her animals up and also to buy sheep to continue growing in business and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is fifty-four years old and is from Sta Maria, Tangub City. She is married and blessed with three children. Florencia works in an agricultural business project raising domestic animals (primarily pigs) to earn an income. She has been in this business for two years and earns about PHP 10,000 per month. 

Recently, Florencia joined GDMPC. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase feeds for her domestic pigs to improve their growth and ensure they have good nourishment. Florencia's plan is to invest the income generated from her loan back into the business, and ultimately hopes to expand the size of the business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Marìa

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 57 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos, Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en  el  Caserío Huaca Blanca del Distrito de Tambogrande, y vive en la parte rural  de este distrito
La actividad que desarrolla María  es la crianza de ganado ovino y vacuno, además de aves de corral, ella  entrega leche a la Municipalidad de Tambogrande donde entrega 12 litros por día.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 1500 nuevos soles y  lo invertirá en la  compra de 01 vaca lechera lo cual le permitirá incrementar las ventas diarias de leche, y además  cuenta con una parte del costo total de la vaca.
texts.en:
María is a 57 year old single woman with no children.  She lives in her own house located in Caserío Huaca Blanca in Tambogrande District; she lives in the rural part of this district.

The activity that María does is raising sheep and cattle as well as barnyard fowl.  She sells 12 liters of milk per day in Tambogrande Municipality.

The amount of the requested loan is 1500 new soles to buy a dairy cow that will make it possible for her to increase her daily milk sales.  She already has part of the total cost of the cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ma.fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is married with four children; she is 41 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin.

Ma. Fe is a farmer and raises livestock to earn a living, which she has been doing for three years. 

Ma. Fe has been a member of PMPC for two years, and she has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional feed for her livestock. In the future, Ma. Fe hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 61 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin. She is married with eight children. Tita has a store that sells a variety of products, and she has been in this business for ten years. 

Tita has been a member of PMPC for seven years, and she requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional products for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is married with two children. Jennifer is twenty-nine-years-old and lives in the Philippines. Jennifer is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to earn a living. She's been doing this for two years and every month she earns PHP 5,000 from it. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. In 2011, Jennifer joined GDMPC. In the future, Jennifer hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is from Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is thirty-nine years old. Merla is married and has three children. To make a living, she manages a business buying and selling fish and crabs. She has been engaged in her business for thirteen years and earns PHP 4,000 a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Merla joined GDMPC. Merla is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 which will be used to buy additional fish and crabs to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and crabs to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 48 years old.  She is married and has three children that are two, 10 and 15 years old.  She has operated a sari-sari store (general store) business for a year-and-a-half.  She sells shampoo, soap, coffee, vinegar and various other items.  She also sells gasoline to members of her community.

Lorna is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise such as canned goods and gasoline to sell.  She hopes to increase her income so that she can save for her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as canned goods and gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Nemesiana

texts.en:
Nemesiana is a married woman with three children that are 16, 18 and 20 years of age.  Her husband works as a rice farmer.

Nemesiana is a vegetable farmer.  She grows squash, eggplant and other vegetables. She earns 4,000 PHP per month through her efforts farming.  She has requested a loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  She hopes to have a productive business and for her family to have a more comfortable standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Flora Mae

texts.en:
Flora Mae is from Garang, Tangub City. She is forty-seven years old. Flora Mae is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Flora Mae is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Flora Mae has been in her business for a year and earns PHP 6,000 a month for these activities.

Flora Mae is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps etc. In 2011, Flora Mae joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is sixty-four years old, married, and has six children. 

Rosita is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and pay farm laborers.

Rosita has been farming sugarcane for ten years now, and has borrowed twenty times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pay farm laborers.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 48 years old and married with four children. With 2 children in school, Sally works very hard to provide for them.

Sally runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Sally has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, shampoo, sugar, toothpaste, spices, etc.

In the future Sally would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is forty-six years old and married with nine children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock for the store.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid for six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising livestock and farming vegetables.

Mary Jane aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock for the store.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is a married woman having five children. Ailyn is twenty-nine years old, residing Molicay, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Ailyn owns and operates a flower garden, planting flowers for sale to earn a living. She's been doing this for two years and earns PHP 8,000 a month from it.  

She requested a loan of PHP 10,900 to purchase another variety of flowers to raise and sell. In 2008 Ailyn became a member of GDMPC. In the future, Ailyn wants to make improvements to her business and to support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase another variety of flowers to raise and sell.

loans.name: Bartola

texts.es: La  señora  Bartola es  una  persona  muy trabajadora,  a lo largo de su  vida   se a  preocupado  por  crear   un patrimonio  para  sus  hijos  ya que  son lo mas  importante para ella,  es  por  eso que    se  acerco  a la  institución ya  que   desea  acondicionar  su  vivienda, en  este  momento  desea    colocar   el  piso  en  su  domicilio  ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de  que   su  hogar  tenga  una mejor  imagen  por lo  que  se  encuentra  muy  contenta  de  habernos  encontrado.
texts.en: Bartola is a very hard working person. The thing that she has been most concerned with throughout her life has been creating something to give to her children; they are what is most important to her. It is for this reason that she became a member of the communal bank, because she wants to make improvements to her home. Right now she would like to install a floor in her house. She saw the opportunity to be able to take out a loan to be able to make her home more attractive. She is very happy that she found the communal bank.

loans.use: to install a floor in her home.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago is married with 3 children. He is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Santiago operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years and every month he earns 6,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Santiago has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years. In the future, he hopes to finish paying for the study of his children and to double the income  from his business.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma nació en el Cusco, es una joven de 32 años de edad, convive con su pareja y juntos tienen un taller de Imprenta donde elaboran todo tipo de papelería y propaganda impresa.

 Ellos se dedican a esta actividad hace algún tiempo, y les va muy bien, por ello ahora necesitan de un préstamo para implementar su negocio y comprar insumos y papelería.

Norma tiene fe que su empresa crecerá, por ello trabaja duro, Ella pertenece al Banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Norma was born in Cusco.  She is 32 years old and lives with her partner.  The couple have a printing workshop where they produce all kinds of stationery and printed materials.

Norma and her partner have been in this business for some time and it is doing very well.  They need a loan to stock the business, buying supplies and stationery.

Norma believes that her business will grow and she works hard to achieve this.  She is a member of the “Señor de los Temblores II” community bank which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy supplies and stationery for her printing business

loans.name: Nonalie

texts.en:
Nonalie is forty years old with three children.

Nonalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Nonalie has borrowed and paid for eighteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading.

Nonalie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is single, from Montol, Misamis Occidental. He is twenty-eight years old. To make a living, Ruel owns and operates a bakery shop, baking and selling a variety of baked breads in the local community. Ruel has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Ruel is requesting a loan of 10,850 PHP, which will be used to to purchase flour, sugar, baking soda, lard and seasoning flavor. In 2008, Ruel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, baking soda, lard and seasoning flavor.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell in her vegetable-vending business.

Jacqueline has been in this business for five years. Jacqueline earns additional income from buying and selling rice and from a general store.

Jacqueline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ruth Chan

texts.en:
Ruth Chan is a married woman who has three children. Ruth Chan is thirty-two years old, and resides at Kapalaran, Tambulig. Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Ruth Chan raises pigs to sell for a living and she's been three years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of work. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. In 2010, Ruth Chan  joined GDMPC. In the future, Ruth Chan wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Remedios works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit and vegetable-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and rice retail. Remedios is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her fruit and vegetable-vending business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 47 years old and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no children. Mario has a general store and earns approximately 2,500 PHP each month. 

Mario has been a member of PMPC for almost a year, and he has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more stock for his general store. In the future, Mario hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his general store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with two children. Josephine is forty-six years old, and resides in Gotocan Daku, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Josephine owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for ten years and earns PHP 6,000 a month from it. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,524 to purchase fertilizer and pay for coconut-planting. In 2008 Josephine became a member of GDMPC. In the future, Josephine wants to make improvements to her house and to support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for coconut-planting.

location.town: Gotocan Daku, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Anie

texts.en:
Anie is 39 years old and lives in Dagohoy, Guipo, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with two children. To earn a living, Anie has a rice field, and she earns about 10,000 PHP each month. 

Anie has been a member of PMPC for four years, and she has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase more fertilizer for her rice field. In the future, she plans to purchase another rice field.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en: Marichu is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP15,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell. Marichu has been in this business for five years. Marichu also earns income from buying and selling livestock. Marichu sustains her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Orlando

texts.es:
Manuel es un joven muy trabajador, junto a su pareja tienen 1 pequeño hijo de 3 años al que quiere muchísimo y por el cual trabaja con mucho esmero para sacarlo adelante y sea muy feliz; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, playas hermosas y encontramos uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país que son Las Islas Ballestas así como también el “Candelabro de paracas”; como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país y por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Ceviche”; el solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería Mecánica.

Con mucho entusiasmo Manuel sale a trabajar diariamente en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi; trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 50 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismáticos y sobre todo porque conoce muy bien todas las rutas de su ciudad.

Manuel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento  general a su vehículo y podrá conducir un vehículo en buenas condiciones y con mayor seguridad para sus clientes, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y seguir luchando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño: “Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Manuel is a very hard working young man. With his wife he has a small son, who is three years old. He loves him very much and it is for him that he works diligently to be able to help his family get ahead so that they can be happy. His home is located in Pisco, a city that is known for having a hot climate, beautiful beaches and also where one of the most important tourist attractions is found, the islands of Ballestas, as well as the "Candelabro de paracas". Like all good Peruvians, Manuel likes the traditional food of Peru, his favorite dish being ceviche. He was only able to study up to 5th grade of elementary school but he would have liked to have studied mechanical engineering.  

Manuel enthusiastically goes to work everyday in his business as a rickshaw driver. He works around 10 hours daily, serving up to 50 customers total throughout the day. He believes that his business is doing well because he is very charismatic and because he knows all of the routes in the city very well.

Manuel is very thankful to the lenders on Kiva, thanks to the help they have provided he is able to do maintenance on his vehicle and can drive his vehicle in good condition and with better security for his customers. This will allow him to have better income and continue moving forward day to day to be able to one day make his biggest dream come true, to own his own home.

loans.use: to do maintenance and repairs on his rickshaw.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business in the Philippines buying and selling root crops. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her business buying and selling root crops.

Saturnina has been in this business for 7 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Saturnina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Anacela

texts.en:
Anacela is 41 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school, and Anacela works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, shampoo, toothpaste, and eggs. 

Anacela requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stock for her general store. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is single and 34 years old, and he lives in Digson, Bonifacio. Elias operates a general store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for six years and every month he earns 5,000 PHP. 

This year, Elias joined GDMPC, and he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. Elias hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his general store.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is thirty-three years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Mary Jane has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Necel

texts.en:
Necel is married and has one child. Necel is twenty-three years old and lives in Kapatagan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Necel is a farmer and she manages their rice production business to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years and every month she earns PHP 8,000 from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay labor costs of land plowing. Necel has been a member of GDMPC for a year. Necel hopes to expand her rice fields and improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to pay labor costs of land plowing.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is twenty-five years old, married, and has two children. 

Marlyn is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marlyn has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is fifty-five years old and married with three children.

Juditha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Juditha has borrowed and paid for five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from ice-cream vending.

Juditha aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is fifty-nine years old and married with six children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, snack foods, sugar, etc. to sell in her general store.

Myrna has borrowed and paid for seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Myrna aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, snack foods and sugar to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is forty-two years old and married with three children.

Elna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Elna has borrowed and paid for seventeen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for thirteen years and also earns an income from fish-vending.

Elna aspires to save enough money to buy farm land.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is thirty-nine years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Ester works very hard to provide for them.

Ester runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Ester has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, snack food, and other groceries. 

In the future Ester would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is married and has a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years, and she works hard to support her family. 

Amy requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items, such as softdrinks, curlers, and soap, for sale. In the future, Amy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 49 years old and married with 2 children.

Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Veronica has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Veronica aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Fayzidin

texts.ru: Файзидин проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу. Он сварщик. Кроме того он занимается ремонтом автомобилей. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения оборудования и необходимых инструментов.
texts.en: Fayzidin lives in the Bohtar district.  He is 43 years old, married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  Fayzidin provides a service.  He is a welder.  Besides this work, he is also involved in repairing cars.  He has been in this business for 15 years.  Fayzidin is requesting this loan to purchase equipment and essential tools.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and essential tools

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Халима уже два года как занимается торговлей семечек. Она покупает семечки, чистит потом распределяет в небольшие и большие пакеты для продажи. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж занимается строительными работами. Халима берет кредит для покупки несколько мешков семечек.
texts.en: Halima has been involved in selling seeds for two years.  She buys seeds, cleans them and then packs them into small and large bags for sale.  Halima is 39 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband is involved in construction work.  Halima is requesting this loan to buy several bags of seeds.

loans.use: to purchase several bags of seeds

loans.name: Tojinisso

texts.ru: Точиниссо более пяти лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит скот у себя дома. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Она берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Tojinisso has been involved in animal husbandry for over five years.  She breeds livestock at home.  Tojinisso is 42 years old, married and has five children.  She is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.ru: Фазилат жительница города Худжанд. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает женскую одежду. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Fazilat is a resident of the city of Khujand.  She is 42 years old, married and has two children.  She leases a retail outlet at a market, where she sells women's clothing.  She has been in this business for five years.  Fazilat is requesting this loan to buy seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Azenith

texts.en:
Azenith is 31 years old and married with three children. She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines. Azenith has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income selling ready-to-wear clothing. 

Azenith is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and additional pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her goals, which include saving enough money to buy a motorbike for her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is 48 years old and single. She is from the village of Kapalaran, Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur. She used her last loan to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her crop. Her rice production business grew and became successful. Now, she's taking a loan to purchase seedlings and pay workers to plow her land. She hopes to be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and pay workers to plow her land.

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru: Точинисо проживает в районе Яван. Она замужем. Ей 46 лет. У нее шестеро детей. Она занимается скотоводством. В основном она откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Tojiniso lives in the Yavan district.  She is 46 years old, married and has six children.  She is involved in animal husbandry.  She primarily fattens up and sells livestock.  Tojiniso is requesting this loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en: Nieva is a widow with two children. She is 63 years old, residing in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Nieva owns and operates a pig business, raising pigs for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 6,477 PHP to purchase breeding livestock. Nieva has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Nieva wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en: Florenda is married with 3 children. She is 54 years old and lives in Buracan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Florenda owns and operates a plot of coconut farm land. She has been in this business for 15 years and earns 5,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to pay labor costs in coconut harvesting. Florenda has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Florenda's plan is to save her profits for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay labor costs in coconut harvesting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal wholesale

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 31 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for seven years and earns additional income from fishing and operating a general store. 

Jean is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs and repair her fishing boat. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is a married woman with two children. She is 52 years old and lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Rosela is starting a business selling seafood products, including crabs, fish, and shrimp, in the local community. She's been in this business for ten years, and she earns 3,000 PHP a month.  

Rosela has been a member of GDMPC since 2009, and she requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase crabs, shrimp, and fish to sell. In the future, Rosela wants to own a motorcab.

loans.use: to purchase crabs, shrimp, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita runs a sari-sari store business in her town. She sells various items like sugar, vinegar, shampoo, soap and rice. She earns 2000 PHP per month with her business. Her husband works as a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) driver. Together they work hard to meet their needs and improve their lives.

Julita has requested a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, such as rice and canned goods. She hopes for her sales to increase.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, such as rice and canned goods

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique tiene 50 años de edad tiene un hijo es soltero, vive con EL hijo en el cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar.
Luis Enrique se dedica al comercio de granos como maíz, arveja, frejol, trigo, cebada, lenteja, habas, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar granos de maíz, fréjol, lenteja además fertilizantes, insecticidas para los pequeños cultivos que tiene.
Con la ayuda podrá comprar los granos y comprar fertilizantes sin ningún tipo de problema.
Las compras y ventas de los productos las realiza en Chillanes.
El sueño es construir una vivienda propia y construir una bodega para almacenar el grano.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el seguir trabajando y con el tiempo seguir agrandando el negocio.

En el tiempo libre le gusta leer escribir, entretetenerse con los niños, hacer deportes, participar en festividades patronales del sector y de los recintos, fiestas de carnaval, navidad.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique tiene 50 años de edad tiene un hijo es soltero, vive con su hijo en el cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar.
Luis Enrique se dedica al comercio de granos como maíz, arveja, frejol, trigo, cebada, lenteja, habas, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos.
Solicita el crédito para incrementar su negocio como comerciante.
Con la ayuda del crédito mejoraría la producción y obtendría buenas cosechas además tendría mayor ingreso con la crianza y venta de sus animales.
Las compras y ventas de los productos las realiza con frecuencia en Chillanes.
El sueño es construir una vivienda propia y para su negocio necesita un local.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el ponerse el negocio y no saber si será estable ya que habrá ganancias como también pérdidas.
En el tiempo libre le gusta leer escribir, entretetenerse con los niños, hacer deportes, participar en festividades patronales del sector y de los recintos, fiestas de carnaval, navidad.

Luis Enrique is 50 years old. He has a son and is single. He lives with his son in the canton of Chillanes, in the province of Bolivar.

Luis Enrique works in the grain business, dealing with products such as corn, peas, beans, wheat, barley, lentils, and fava benas. In addition, he raises chickens. He is applying for the loan to expand his business as a merchant.

With the help of the loan, he will improve production and obtain better harvests, and in addition he will have better income from raising and selling his animals. He makes his purchases and sells his products in Chillanes.

His dream is to build his own house, and he needs a location for his business.

The challenges he faces are setting up his business and not knowing if it will be stable, since there will be earnings as will as losses.

In his free time he likes to read, write, play with the children, play sports, participate in festivities for patron saint festivities in the district and in the area and in Carnival and Christmas celebrations

loans.use: to purchase seeds of corn, beans, and lentils, as well as fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine is 31 years old and married with one child.

Katherine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been running her sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income selling rice. 

Katherine has previously borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF. She has now requested a 22,000 PHP loan to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. She aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rona works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines and earns additional income selling froozen foods. Rona is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy clothing items, such as t-shirts, pants, and blouses, for sale.

Rona has used 14 loans from NWTF to sustain her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing for sale.

loans.name: Chuluun

texts.en: Chuluun is a 50-year-old woman who lives with her two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her elder child is now employed and the younger one is a college student. She started her meat retailing business in 2000 by renting a counter in a market. Over the years she gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. Now that her child is in college, she needs to expand her business. She rented another counter in a market; however, she needs 2,500,000 MNT in order to buy more meat at wholesale prices to run the counter.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es:
Joaquín  tiene 59 años de edad es casado tiene ocho hijos, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. pertenece a la ventanilla rural Balacelo esta conformado por 10 miembros. 
Joaquín se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz frejol arveja.
Solicita el crédito para comprar los insumos necesarios para la producción del frejol como es 2qq de urea, 2qq de abono, 2 litros de líquidos para fumigar. 
Con la ayuda del crédito puedo comprar os insumos por medio de los cuales tendré buena producción y mejorara los ingresos.
Las compras y ventas de los productos las realiza con frecuencia en el Cantón Chillanes cada ocho días.
El sueño es mejorar las cosechas, tener ingresos más altos para apoyar la educación de todos sus hijos. 
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las vías dañadas, el mal clima, perdida de las cosechas.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y pasar junto a su familia, le gusta escuchar el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Joaquín, 59, is married and has 8 children.  He lives with his wife and children in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.  He belongs to the Balacelo communal bank which has ten members.  Joaquín is a corn, bean and pea farmer.

He asks for a loan to buy needed supplies for his bean crops like 2 quintals of urea, 2 quintals of manure and 2 liters of fumigating liquid.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy the supplies that will allow him to have a good production and improved income.

His product purchases and sales take place frequently in Chillanes Canton weekly.  His dream is to improve crops, to earn higher income to support all of his children’s education.  The challenges he faces are damaged roads, bad weather and loss of crops.  In his free time he enjoys resting and spending time with his family; he likes to listen to Carnival.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and urea.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 72 años de edad es casado, tiene un hijo,  vive con su esposa e hija en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar.
Manuel se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, frejol, arveja, lenteja, etc.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos necesarios como urea 1qq, abono 2qq y fertilizantes 3 litros para fumigar.
Con la ayudad del crédito tendré una notable mejora en las cosechas y así podre darle un mejor estilo de vida a mi hija.
Las compras de insumos agrícolas lo realizan con frecuencia en el Cantón Chillanes cada ocho días. 
El sueño es ver a su hija progresar en sus estudios, e incrementar sus ingresos para tener un mejor estilo de vida y aumentar sus sembríos.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las vías en mal estado, que el mal tiempo podría dañar sus sembríos y perdería sus cosechas.
En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo junto a su familia, ver partidos de futbol, y escuchar el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Manuel is 72 years old and is married. He has on child and lives with his wife and daughter in the canton of Chillanes located in the province of Bolívar. Manuel makes a living in agriculture planting corn, beans, peas, and lentils, etc. 

He is requesting a loan to buy necessary supplies like one quintal [100 lbs.] of urea, two quintales [200 lbs.] of manure, and three liters of fertilizers to fumigate. "With the help from this loan I will have notably improved harvests and will be able to give my daughter a better style of life." He frequently purchases agricultural supplies in the canton of Chillanes every eight days. 

His dream is to see his daughter progress in her studies and to increase his income so that he can have a better style of life and increase his crops. The challenges he faces are bad roads, bad weather that can damage his crops, and the loss of his harvests.

In his free time he likes to go out with his family, watch soccer matches, and go listen to the Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, urea, manure, and seeds.

loans.name: Karen Elizabeth

texts.es: Karen , es una joven madre, casada, humilde campesina , originaria de la Ceiba una comunidad localizada en las afueras de León . Ella es ama de casa, pero también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos actividad que tradicionalmente realiza las mujeres del campo. Ella lleva 5 años dedicándose al cuido y crianza de cerdos de desarrollo con las ganancias ella ha venido formando una pequeña pulpería. Es de esta manera que apoya a su hogar para el bienestar de su familia. Está requiriendo el préstamo para comprar cerdos de desarrollo. Uno de sus sueños es lograr tener una granja de cerdos de raza.
texts.en: Karen is a young, married mother.  She is a humble countrywoman, originally from la Ceiba, a community on the outskirts of León.  She is a homemaker but also raises pigs.  This is a traditional business activity among women in the countryside.  She has been caring for and raising pigs for five years.  She has been using the profits to set up a small grocery store.  In this way, she supports her household and looks after her family's well-being.  She needs this loan to buy pigs to raise.  One of her dreams is to have a farm where she raises purebred pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She also earns income from farming sugarcane and e-loading.

Valerie is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock for sale in her sari-sari store. She has sustained her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. In the future, she dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for sale in her general store.

loans.name: Fredy Braulio

texts.es:
Fredy es un hombre muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener hermosas playas, por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz y también tiene como actividad la pesca. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mirar películas y sobre todo le encanta comer uno de sus platos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo pescado frito. 

Día a día Fredy trabaja mucho para salir adelante en su negocio de venta de agua en su camión cisterna; trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo vende agua limpia a los clientes.

Fredy está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su apoyo y gracias a esa gran ayuda el podrá realizar un mantenimiento y reparacion a su cisterna, con esta mejora podrá tener un vehículo en buenas condiciones y seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” Tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Fredy is a hard-working, enthusiastic man.  He lives in Camana, a city known for its beautiful beaches and agriculture, especially for the cultivation of rice.  It is also a good area for fishing.  When he has free time, Fredy enjoys watching movies and especially loves to eat delicious fried fish, one of his favorite dishes.

Fredy sells water from his tank truck and works day by day to get his business ahead.  He works about ten hours a day and may serve up to ten customers per day.  He believes that his business is going well because he is very nice and most importantly, he sells clean water to his customers.

Fredy is very grateful for the Kiva loans as this is the second time they are offering him help.  Thanks to this great help, he will be able to perform maintenance and make repairs to his tank.  With this improvement, he will have a vehicle in good condition and be able to continue striving each day to make his great dream a reality-“to have a bigger business”.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Merlin Elizabeth

texts.es:
Merlín Elizabeth tiene 30 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con sus hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos. pertenece a la ventanilla Los Girasoles.

Merlín Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como maquillaje, pinturas de uñas.

Solicita el crédito para invertir en productos de belleza como maquillaje, pinturas para uñas y crear un puesto de jugos.

Con la ayuda del crédito ahora puedo poner un puesto de jugos.  

Las compras y ventas de los productos necesarios las realiza frecuentemente en el Cantón Ventanas.

El sueño es poder construir una casa para vivienda y ponerse un negocio. 

Para ella no existen desafíos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a los quehaceres del hogar.
texts.en:
Merlín Elizabeth is 30 years old, she is married and has two children. She lives with her children in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province, she is part of the Los Girasoles communal bank.

Merlín Elizabeth earns her livelihood selling beauty products such as makeup and nail varnishes. She is asking for this loan to invest in beauty products such as makeup and nail varnishes and set up a juice bar. Using this loan, she can now set up a fruit juice bar. She frequently buys and sells the necessary products in the Ventanas canton. 

Her dream is to build a house to live in and set up a business. For her, there are no challenges. In her free time, she likes getting on with the household chores.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as makeup, nail varnishes and set up a juice bar.

loans.name: Maria Sabina

texts.es:
María es una mujer  de 49 años de edad, madre soltera y con 01 hijo. Vive en casa de su padre, la casa está ubicada en el caserío Las Mercedes de Partidor Distrito  Las Lomas. Cliente vive en la parte  rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad que desarrolla María es la agricultura y ganadería, y siembra conjuntamente con su padre; el terreno es 7.0 has. Pero ellos solo siembran 2.0 y el resto las arriendan. Para el caso de la ganadería cuentan con corrales apropiados para la crianza de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.
El  monto del crédito solicitado es de 2000 nuevos soles y  será para la compra de fertilizantes  para  realizar el segundo abonamiento en el cultivo de arroz que tienen instaladas.
texts.en:
María is a 49-year-old woman.  She is a single mother and has one child.  She lives in her father's house in the small village of Las Mercedes de Partidor, in Las Lomas district.  She lives in the rural part of the district but has electricity.  

María's business consists of farming and livestock raising.  She sows her crops together with her father.  They have 7 hectares of land but only grow crops on 2 hectares and rent the rest out.  As regards the livestock raising, they have suitable pens for raising sheep, pigs and farmyard birds.  When they reach an ideal size and weight, they sell them in the local market.

María has requested a loan for 2,000 soles which she will use to buy fertilizers so that she can carry out the second fertilization of her rice crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice crop

loans.name: María Zoila

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer que  tiene  34 años de edad  de  estado civil soltera domiciliada en el casorio Sassape Viejo del distrito de Túcume.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica María  es brindar servicio de corte  de cabello, cuenta con experiencia de  10  años , adicionalmente vende productos de belleza , este negocio esta  ubicado en su propio domicilio,  cuenta con clientela fija (comerciantes de mercados).
 El monto del crédito solicitado es de 2000 nuevos soles y el préstamo se destinara para inversión en la  compra de  herramientas para corte de cabello-peluquería; actualmente  se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente al  corte de cabello que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona.
texts.en:
Maria, 34 years old, was a single woman until she wed Sassape Viejo from the district of Túcume.

The way Maria makes a living is to offer haircutting services, which she has ten years of experience doing, and she also sells beauty products.  This business is located in her own home, and she has regular customers (market traders).  

The amount of the loan she has requested is 2000 nuevos soles and the loan will be set aside to invest in the purchase of tools for cutting hair in her hair salon.  At the moment she has proposed to increase her inventory in regard to cutting hair because it is a very profitable activity in the area.

loans.use: to buy tools for her hair salon.

loans.name: Murtazo

texts.ru: Муртазо более 30 лет занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Ему 48 лет. Он в основном сеет пшеницу и кукурузу. Муртазо женат. У него шестеро детей. Он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Murtazo has been involved in sowing agricultural crops for over 30 years.  He is 48 years old.  He primarily sows wheat and corn.  Murtazo is married and has six children.  He is requesting this loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: El Puente Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama El puente esta conformado por  diez mujeres indígenas y trabajadoras con deseos de mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Las integrantes de este grupo son originarias de pinotepa nacional tierra de gente  buena trabajadora.
En pinotepa nacional hay mucha  gente que tiene sus pequeños negocios  es el reflejo de su trabajo y amor por progresar.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora  Adelfa Celsa de cuarenta años de edad, doña Celsa   como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo se caracteriza por ser una señora trabajadora y amable.
Doña Celsa  se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos desde hace  tres años lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es atender bien a sus clientas y cocinarles con amor.
Pero lo que Casio no le gusta es que se desvela mucho ya que sus antojitos mexicanos los vende en las noches  saca su mesa y su  platillos.
También se dedica a la cerrajería ya que saca duplicados de llaves se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace  diez años.
Esta muy contenta por que sus dos ganancias le dejan buenas ganancias y así puede  tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Gonzalo  con quien tiene  tres hijas Araceli, Jessica y Liliana sus mas grandes tesoros.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más ingredientes para la elaboración de antojitos mexicanos  como son: jitomate, cebolla, ajo, queso, quesillo, pollo tortillas la otra es parte  es para  la compra de más llaves  y candados para la cerrajería.
Nos dice que esta muy contenta con fundacion por ayudarla a que su negocio crezca  cada día mas.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Socorro-  quien se dedica a la venta de  mercancía de abarrotes.
Esther- quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Dulce Olivia -quien se dedica a brindar  servicio de música.
Florencia Griselda - quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Olivia Lucila- quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Isabel Claudia – quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Gloria-quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Carmen- quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Ma Isabel-quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudarles a que su negocios crezcan y con sus ganancias tener una mejor calidad de vida.
* la señora que no se ve en la fotografia es la señora isabel  claudia.
texts.en:
This group is called 'El Puente' (The Bridge).  It is made up of ten indigenous, hard-working women who would like to improve their lives and those of their families.

The members of this group are from Pinotepa Nacional which is home to good, hard-working people.  In Pinotepa Nacional, there are a lot of people who run small businesses.  It is a reflection of their hard work and their desire to make progress.

One of the members of this group is Adelfa Celsa who is 40 years old.  Celsa, as she is better known among her fellow group members, is noted for being a kind, hard-working lady.

Celsa's business is selling Mexican snacks.  She has been in this business for three years.  What she most enjoys about her business is serving her customers and cooking for them with love.

However, what Celsa does not enjoy is having to stay awake so late because she sells her snacks at nighttime, getting out her table and her dishes.  

Celsa also works as a locksmith, making duplicates of keys.  She has been in this business for ten years.  She is very happy because her two businesses make her good profits and she is thereby able to enjoy a better quality of life.

Celsa is happily married to Gonzalo and the couple have three daughters: Araceli, Jessica and Liliana, who are their pride and joy.

Celsa requested this loan to buy more ingredients for making Mexican snacks such as tomatoes, onions, garlic, cheese, 'quesillo' (soft cheese), chicken and tortillas.  She will use the rest of the money to buy more keys and padlocks for her locksmith business.

Celsa tells us that she is very happy with Fundación Realidad for helping her to continue to grow her business.

The other members of this group are:
Socorro - who sells groceries.
Esther - who sells Mexican snacks
Dulce Olivia - who provides a music service
Florencia Griselda - who sells Mexican snacks.
Olivia Lucila - who sells clothing.
Isabel Claudia - who sells soft drinks.
Gloria - who sells perfumes.
Carmen - who sells groceries.
Maria Isabel - who sells perfumes.

The ladies would like to thank Fundación Realidad for helping them to grow their businesses so that they can use their profits to enjoy a better quality of life.

* The lady who does not appear in the photograph is Isabel Claudia.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making Mexican snacks

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig is a 29-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in Central Province, Mongolia. His oldest child studies at the secondary school. His wife is unemployed and stays at home with their daughter. 

Since 2006, he has been running a delivery service business with his truck. He delivers coal and vegetables. He is planning to expand his business activities further. 

Ganzorig is an active man who says, "I would like to expand the business activities by building a workplace for the food store. I have researched a lot on this field and am trying to build the new business successfully with the support.” The total amount he is requesting is 3,500,000 MNT to build a workplace.

loans.use: to build a workplace for the food store.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 21 год. Он холост. У него высшее неоконченное экономическое образование. На сегодняшний день Сухроб занимается торговлей. У него имеется продуктовый магазин. В этой области он три года. Он берет кредит для покупки кондитерских изделий.
texts.en: Suhrob lives in the city of Istaravshan.  He is 21 years old and single.  He has an incomplete higher economics education.  Today, Suhrob is involved in sales.  He has a food market.  He has been in this business for three years.  Suhrob is requesting this loan to buy confectionery goods.

loans.use: to purchase confectionery goods

loans.name: Oyunaa

texts.en:
Oyunaa, 48 years old, lives with her husband and a daughter in a traditional 'ger' in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is employed, and Oyunaa has been running an ice cream retail business since 2008, offering a variety of ice cream and other frozen products. She has some regular, contracted suppliers and customers in the field, and her business activities are stable.

Oyunaa, a good-natured woman, says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing a small van with a freezer," and so is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy one.

loans.use: to buy a van with a freezer.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 33 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Шоира занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она берет заказы на дому. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для покупки необходимых тканей и ниток.
texts.en: Shoira lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 33 years old, married and has two children.  Shoira is involved in sewing national dresses.  She accepts her work orders at home.  Shoira has been in this business for 20 years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase necessary fabrics and threads.

loans.use: to buy necessary fabrics and threads

loans.name: Delgermaa

texts.en:
Delgermaa is a 47-year-old woman who lives with her husband in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her husband is unemployed. 

She started an antique shop business in 2000, based on her major in religious study. She trades antique things and religious articles. As most of Mongolians belong to Buddhism, there is a big need, and she has many regular customers. 

She started renting a well-positioned shop counter near the local temple. Now she is aiming to raise the assets by purchasing the religious articles wholesale. 

Delgermaa is a good-natured woman who says, "I would like to develop the business activity by purchasing the products in large quantities for economic reasons.”  The total amount she is requesting is 3,500,000 MNT to buy religious supplies.

loans.use: to buy religious supplies.

loans.name: Choidemchig

texts.en:
Choidemchig is a 50-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in Central Province, Mongolia. Her husband is a fireman. Her older son studies at the local secondary school and the youngest child goes to the kindergarten. 

She has been running a computer service business since 2005. She rents the building space at the Central Province and offers printing and copying services with additional stationery retail.
