Choidemchig is a hardworking woman who says, "I would like to have some support for the business to purchase stationery items and additional printer equipment." The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy additional stationery products.

loans.use: to buy additional stationery products.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria, who is married to a farmer, has six children between the ages of 10 and 21 years. The owner of a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol, Candelaria earns 5000 PHP per month selling items including soft drinks, eggs and toiletries. She said she wants to help provide for her family's needs and sustain her children's education. She also supports her husband's farming and helps in selling his harvest.

Candelaria is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as canned goods to sell. She hopes to earn better and be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.ru: Собирчон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 58 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Собирчон более восьми лет занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Sobirjon lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  He is 58 years old, married and has four children.  Sobirjon has been involved in sowing agricultural crops for over eight years.  He is requesting this loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She sells coconut wine to her community. She earns 5,000 PHP per month with her business. This enables her to help in providing for her family's basic needs.

Catalina would like to request a loan to purchase food coloring and containers. This will help her distribute coconut wine to her customers. Catalina hopes for her business to grow and for her family to have a more stable living.

loans.use: to purchase food coloring and containers.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora, es madre y sus hijos tienen 14 y 17 años respectivamente, ella los ama muchísimo y por ellos  trabaja y busca la manera de seguir adelante para darles una vida feliz y sobre todo para que sea su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener hermosas playas, por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz y también tiene como actividad la pesca. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a caminar por la playa ya que le ayuda a despejarse y distraerse, también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “lomo Saltado”.

María se dedica a la preparación de bolillos, los cuales son una especie de pan en forma de bolitas y son muy sabrosos, ella trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene buena sazón y sobretodo es muy amable con los clientes.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar instrumentos de panadería como moldes, pinzas de pan, entre otros para así poder tener las herramientas necesarias para su trabajo y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener una panadería”.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hardworking woman. She is the mother of two children, who are 14 and 17 respectively. She loves them very much and she works for them and finds a way to keep going, in order to give them a happy life above all.

Her residence is located in the city of Camana, which is known for its beautiful beaches and its agriculture, specially the cultivation of rice. Fishing is another local activity. When she has free time, she enjoys going out to walk along the beach, since this helps her clear her mind and pass the time. She also enjoys eating one of her favorite dishes, which is the delicious "lomo saltado."

María prepares "bolillos," which are a type of bread in the shape of small balls and is very tasty. She works around 12 hours daily and may serve up to 30 customers during the day. She believes her business is going well because she is a good cook and above all she is very nice to her customers.

Maria is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the support they have offered she will be able to purchase baking utensils, such as baking tins and bread tongs, among other things. This way she will have the necessary tools for her work and will be able to improve her income, which will allow her to keep working and fighting every day so that she can make her greatest dream come true: "To own a bakery."

loans.use: to purchase baking utensils (baking tins and bread tongs, among other things).

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina is 35 years old, married, and a mother of three children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling goods at her retail shop. She earns a monthly profit of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and is applying for her third loan of KES 50,000 to buy additional stock for her shop such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, cooking flour, and so on, to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as to expand her shop. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and cooking flour

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 42 years old, married and the mother of two children.  For the last ten years, she has earned a living by selling fish in Malindi.  She earns a monthly profit of 15,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers.  She is applying for her second loan in the amount of 40,000 KES in order to buy additional fish to stock and sell to her customers.  She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees as well as to expand her business. 

Her goal for the future is to continue with her current business with the possibility of owning a fish depot in the area.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to stock and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 25 years old, married, and the father of one child. For the last four years, he has earned a living by selling goods from his retail shop. He earns a monthly profit of KES 20,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers. He is applying for his first loan for KES 100,000 to buy additional stock such as soft drinks, cooking oil, and foodstuffs such as flour to sell to his customers. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay his child's school fees. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cooking oil, and foodstuffs such as flour.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol.  She has six children, the youngest of whom still attends school.  Her husband works as a rice farmer.

Cirila grows vegetables like squash and eggplants.  She earns 5,000 PHP per month with this business.  Cirila has applied for a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Cirila hopes to expand her vegetable garden and include more crops in the future. She also hopes for her family's standard of living to improve.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jonas Anthony

texts.en:
Jonas Anthony is 29 years old and single.  He has had a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business for six years. He earns 8,000 PHP per month with his business.  He works hard to save for his future.

Jonas Anthony has requested this loan in order to purchase spare parts and gasoline.  He hopes to acquire another motorcycle and expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline.

loans.name: Delgernomin

texts.en:
Delgernomin is 25 years old.  She lives with her husband, son, mother and sister in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  Her husband helps her run the business and her son is a kindergarten student. 

Delgernomin started her cell phone retailing business in early 2011.  Even though she's fairly new to the business, she has already found a trusted supplier in Korea.  Her business income is stable and her business location is excellent.  Now that smart phones are becoming increasingly popular, she needs to broaden the range of phones she sells. She is a sharp young woman who says, "since my business is the only income in the family, I must do what I can.”  She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy additional phones.

loans.use: to buy additional phones.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas earns a living by selling dry goods to his community. He sells items like men's and women's shirts, slippers, and jeans. Jonas earns 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this business. He works hard to support his family of a wife and two young children. He is also saving for his children's education.

Jonas has requested a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, such as slippers. He hopes to earn better and be able to elevate the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, such as slippers

loans.name: Ruperto

texts.es:
Ruperto es un hombre de 30 años de  edad estado civil convivientes,  con un  hijo menor,  vive con sus hijo y  cónyuge.; la calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia la mayoría  son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercio y crianza de animales, adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura y ha trabajar como dependientes en labores agrícolas (jornal).ubicado en el caserío las pampas s/n – Mòrrope es una zona rural a 30  minutos de Lambayeque.
La  actividad comercial a la que se dedica Ruperto  es la  crianza y comercio  de  animales, así mismo cuenta con experiencia de 6 años en dicha actividad, el negocios esta ubicado en su propio domicilio  cuenta con clientes  fijos; los negociantes que lo compran los animales son de la zona de Chiclayo.
El monto solicitado del préstamo es de 2000 nuevos soles y será para invertir en el  negocio de animales como porcinos, caprinos, ovinos, aves de corral, etc. y compra de alimento para engorde.
texts.en:
Ruperto is 30 years old and is in a common-law marriage with one minor child. He lives with his son and spouse. Quality of life in their community is at a subsistence level. Most people are independent workers who have commercial businesses or raise animals. They also work in agriculture and labor as salaried farmworkers. He is located in Caserío Las Pampas, within Mórrope, which is a rural area 30 minutes from Lambayeque.
Ruperto's commercial activity is raising and selling animals. Also, he has six years of experience in this business. His business is located in his own home. He has a permanent customer base. The merchants who buy animals from him are from the area of Chiclayo.
The loan amount requested is 2000 nuevos soles, which will be invested in the purchase of animals, such as swine, goats, sheep, fowl, etc. and in the purchase of feed to fatten them.

loans.use: to purchase animals and feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Dejidsuren

texts.en:
Dejidsuren is a 50 years old.  She is a widow who lives with her son in Central Province, Mongolia.  Her son is in the army. 

She has been running a retail business, selling meat, since 2010.  She rents a well-positioned shop counter at the local market center.  At this time, her business activities are stable.  Dejidsuren is a diligent, active woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing meat wholesale.  I have a further plan to open my (own) meat shop.”  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 MNT to buy additional meat and supplies.

loans.use: to buy additional meat and supplies.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Judith works hard to support her family. She has a sari-sari (general store) and also earns additional income from selling food.

Judith has been sustaining her store through her past nine loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari. Her ambition is that through hard work she will build and expand her businesses to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 32 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are in school.  She is in the agricultural business, raising goats and chickens in the Philippines. 

Charlyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed for her livestock.

Charlyn has been raising goats and chickens for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Charlyn would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Tseesuren

texts.en:
Tseesuren is thirty, married and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband is employed, and the children go to kindergarten and secondary school.

Tseesuren has sold milk and milk products since 2008. She has a contract with the supplier and has many regular customers. As there is much need for these foods, she is trying to meet this need and deliver her fresh milk products.

Tseesuren is an active woman who says, "My kids are growing up, and I would like to expand my business so as to earn some money to finish building my own house." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT from XacBank to buy construction materials for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house.

loans.name: Uranbileg

texts.en:
Uranbileg is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is employed as a taxi driver. Her oldest son studies at the secondary school and the other children go to the kindergarten. 

Uranbileg has been running a photography business at tourist attractions since 2006. She takes high-quality photos with her own professional camera. Now she is planning to purchase camera and printer accessories for the business. Uranbileg is a talented photographer who says, "I would like to develop my business activities by purchasing the necessary printer and camera accessories." The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy the camera accessories.

loans.use: To buy camera accessories

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 29 years old, married, and has one child. 

Emma is in the agriculture industry, raising pigs in the Philippines. Emma has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emma has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and she has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Emma would like to save money to build another business, such as rice retailing.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 37 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 7 and 15 years. He sells various goods such as Colgate, toilet paper, sugar, salt, lotions, and cooking oil, and he has been in this business for six years. His business is open from 8 am to 7 pm. 

Jean Bosco has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as toothpaste, toilet paper, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is 32 years old and married with 2 children. Consuelo works hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa (woven palm mats) retail business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa to sell.

Consuelo has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the nipa retail business for 8 years, and she also earns an income from rice retailing. Consuelo aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of woven palm mats to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 51 years old and married with 7 children. She earns a living by farming nipa (palm fronds used to make woven mats) in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

Evangeline has been in the nipa business for 20 years, and she also earns additional income from raising livestock and rice retailing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Las Morenitas Group

texts.es:
Gudelina Ávila Cortes tiene 51 años de edad, es casada,  su esposo Francisco es campesino  y tienen 2 hijos a su cargo. Selene es una de sus hijas por lo que le esta ayudando con sus estudios, ella estudia ciencias de la comunicación y el  jovencito estudia 2° de la preparatoria.

Gudelina se dedica a la producción y exportación de frutas como son: Mangos ahorita por su temporada al igual que el plátano,  transporta alrededor de 500 a 600 cajas de frutas por lo que mandan en una camioneta a la ciudad de México. Mientras tanto después de la temporada de la lluvia se dedica a los Limones y a las Papayas. Gudelina tiene 26 años en su trabajo por lo que satisfecha de su éxito, ella  invertirá su préstamo en comprar el doble de semillas de su cosecha anterior, para tener mas ganancias y su meta es exportar a mas Estados de la republica y ser reconocida internacionalmente.

Gudelina es integrante del grupo Las Morenitas integrado por 4 mujeres, nombrado así por que todas ellas son morenitas.
Rosana, Luz Gabriela, Gudelina, y Noelia integran el grupo y se dedican a la venta de: Calzado, Perfumes, Frutas y Productos de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Gudelina Ávila Cortes, 51, is married and her husband, Francisco, is a farmworker.  They have 2 children in their care.  Selene is one of their daughters, and so they are helping her with her education.  She is studying for a degree in communication sciences, and their youngest child is in high school.

Gudelina has a business growing and exporting fruit, such as mangoes.  Right now she is growing bananas.  She transports about 500-600 boxes of fruit that are sent by truck to Mexico City.  Meanwhile, after the rainy season, she works growing lemons and papayas.  Gudelina has been doing this work for 26 years, and she is satisfied with her success.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of twice the number of seeds as her previous crop, so that she can have greater earnings.  Her goal is to export to more states of Mexico and become internationally known.

Gudelina is a member of the group "Las Morenitas," (The Brunettes) which includes 4 women.  It has this name because all of the women are brunettes. The group includes Rosana, Luz Gabriela, Gudelina, and Noelia, and they work selling: shoes, perfumes, fruit and groceries.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant and cultivate

location.town: Cruz Grande, Municipio Florencio Villareal, Estado

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg is a 47-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children in a traditional "ger" (nomadic tent) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is employed as a doorman. Her children study at the secondary school and the college. She started running a retail toy business in 2011. Even though she is quite new to the business, she has some basic knowledge in the field. She has been running the business to feed her children and improve their livelihood. Uranchimeg is a hardworking woman who says, "I would like to develop the business by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices. I am planning to save for my children's education and weddings." The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy more toys.

loans.use: To buy more toys to sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Vicenta has been in this business for 33 years.

Vicenta has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 51 years old and married with 4 children, 2 of whom are in school.

Zenaida is in the agriculture industry, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Zenaida has been raising pigs for 10 years, and she has previously borrowed 22 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She sells fish and also earns income running her general store and e-loading cell phones.

Evelyn has been sustaining her businesses through her past eight loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her to build her businesses so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Salvacion works hard to support her family. She has a peanut vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more peanuts for her business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more peanuts for her business

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 29 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Dina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, snack curls, spices, and canned goods. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

In the future, Dina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 30 years old and married with 2 children. With 2 children in school, she works very hard to provide for her family.

Janet runs a nipa (woven palm mats) retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years. She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional nipa to sell.

In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional nipa to sell

loans.name: Magdalia

texts.en:
Magdalia is 47 years old and married with 5 children. She earns a living by raising chicken in the Philippines. Magdalia has been raising chicken for 3 years, and she also earns additional income from a sari-sari (general) store. 

Magdalia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her chickens. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Акмал занимается посевом пшеницы. ячменя и кукурузы. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 24 года. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Akmal lives in the Jilikul district.  He is 42 years old, married and has three children.  Akmal is involved in sowing wheat, barley and corn.  He has been in this business for 24 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Davlatkhon

texts.ru: Давлатхон проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Давлатхон в основном занимается посевом пшеницы и выращиванием овощей. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 14 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений с целью получения хорошего урожая.
texts.en: Davlatkhon lives in the Jilikul district.  He is 30 years old, married and has two children.  Davlatkhon primarily sows wheat and grows vegetables.  He has been involved in this business for 14 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy mineral fertilizers in order to get a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is thirty years old, married and living in Malaubang, Ozamis City with three children. She started a carinderia, or eatery, type of business three years ago that gives her a monthly income of 4,000 PHP. Her interest in cooking inspired her to invest in this kind of business. 

With the desire to improve it, she would like to borrow the amount of 5,300 PHP from GDMPC in order to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In God’s time, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 42 years old and married with three children.

Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Norma has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from raising pigs and fishing.

Norma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 50 years old and married with 11 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa (woven palm mats) retail business in the Philippines.

Melanie has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of palm mats to sell. She has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the nipa business for 10 years, and she also earns an income from fishing.

Melanie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of palm mats to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married woman with a 13-year-old child. She is involved in farming. She grows rice crops to sell. She also provides manicure/pedicure services to members of her community. Josephine works hard to support her family and help improve their living. She has applied for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Josephine hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Gardelias Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth cuenta con 37 años de edad vive en Las Cruces municipio de San Marcos, es casada su esposo se llama Eleuterio quien se dedica al campo, tienen 3 hijos todos estudian gracias a sus padres por que la señora Elizabeth se dedica al comercio.

Elizabeth mantiene a su familia por que se dedica a la venta de Pan lo cual tiene 2 años en su negocio, Elizabeth invertirá su préstamo para poder tener mas ingresos y sacar adelante la educación de sus 3 hijos, se beneficiará en obtener mas ganancias para aumentar su capital.
Elizabeth como las demás 9 integrantes del grupo que en total son 10 son mujeres trabajadoras capaces de sacar adelante su familia a continuación serán mencionadas y las actividades a las que se dedican como comerciantes: Lidia, Marta, Josefina, Maria, Benita, Guadalupe, Elizabeth, Lizeth, Delia y Estela. Se dedican ala venta de Ropa, Pan, Tamales, Tacos, Abarrotes, Chilate, Pescado, Refrescos,  Botanas, y Atole.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old and lives in Las Cruces in San Marcos Municipality. She is married to her husband, Eleuterio, who is a farmer. They have three children, all of whom are in school thanks to their parents, because Elizabeth is a business woman.

Elizabeth supports her family through her business selling bread, which she has had for two years. She will use her loan in order to earn more income so that she can continue to provide her three children with an education. She will benefit by earning greater profits thereby increasing her capital.

Elizabeth, like the other nine members of the group, which consists of 10 hardworking women overall, is capable of moving her family forward. We will mention the others and their businesses: Lidia, Marta, Josefina, Maria, Benita, Guadalupe, Elizabeth, Lizeth, Delia and Estela. Their business are the sale of clothing, bread, tamales, tacos, groceries, chilate (a drink made with corn, peppers and cocoa), fish, soft drinks, snacks and atole (a hot drink or gruel made with corn flour).

loans.use: to purchase more products and earn more profit in her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a welding/repair shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for thirty years now.

Imelda has requested a loan of 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy machines and other supplies used for welding.

In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy machines and other supplies used for welding.

loans.name: Shomurod

texts.ru: Шомурод проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 55 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Шомурод занимается скотоводством. Он закупает крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более тридцати лет. Кредит берет для закупа теленка.
texts.en: Shomurod lives in the Jilikul district.  He is 55 years old, married and has five children.  Shomurod is involved in animal husbandry.  He buys cattle for subsequent resale.  He has been in this business for over thirty years.  Shomurod is requesting this loan to buy a calf.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is 55 years old and married with five children.

Gena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Gena has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Gena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 37 years old and married with 4 children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elvira has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan amount of 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for furniture making.

Elvira has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for furniture making.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 52 years old and married with 6 children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Belen runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Belen has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Belen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Los Olivos Group

texts.es:
Georgina es una mujer trabajadora, cuenta con 35 años de edad, es casada felizmente vive con el señor José Luis el cual él se dedica a la Herrería y tiene 2 hijos que uno de ellos se llama Jorge Luis tiene 10 años y cursa el 5° de la primaria y la otra niña tiene 7 años y cursa el 1° de la primaria.
Georgina es comerciante la cual tiene una tienda de abarrote que gracias a su trabajo a salido adelante, ella
 piensa invertir su préstamo en mas mercancía para su tiendita como son: Huevos, Detergente, Leche, Refrescos, etc, ya que la necesita porque sus clientes le piden más y son productos que le hacen falta, además quiere agrandar su negocio, es decir en un local más grande, no se queja de las ventas por que afortunadamente le va bien, su tienda está situada en un buen lugar pero para tener más ganancias a su beneficio necesita surtirse.
Georgina es una de las integrantes del grupo Los Olivos, que está integrado por 9  mujeres y 2 hombres muy trabajadores que en total son 11 dedicadas a su negocio lo cual se mencionan y el tipo de trabajo que tienen cada una de ellas: Rosa, Estela, Ricardo, María del  Carmen, Georgina, Beatriz, Rosa Isela, Ignacio, María del Pilar, Gaudencia, y Enedina que se dedican a la venta de: Productos de Abarrotes, Herramientas y Refacciones para vehículos, Pan,  Empanadas, Comida, Perfumes, Pollos, Refrescos,  Material de Papelería.
texts.en:
Georgina is a hardworking woman who is 35 years old and happily married. She lives with Sr. José Luis who works as a blacksmith and has two children, Jorge Luis, who is 10 years old and is in 5th grade in primary school and a 7 year-old girl, who is in the first grade. 

Georgina is a saleswoman who has a grocery store and, thanks to her work, she has moved ahead. She will invest the loan in more merchandise for her little store such as eggs, detergent, milk, soft drinks, etc. since she needs them because her customers request more and these are products that she lacks. As well, she wants to expand her business into a larger space. She cannot complain of her sales because, fortunately, they are doing well. Her store is located in a good spot but in order to earn more income and make more of a profit she needs to stock more merchandise.

Georgina is one of the members of Los Olivos Communal Bank, which consists of nine women and two men, all of them very hardworking. They comprise 11 members, each dedicated to his or her own business. The members are: Rosa, Estela, Ricardo, Maria del Carmen, Georgina, Beatriz, Rosa Isela, Ignacio, Maria del Pilar, Gaudencia and Enedina. They sell groceries, tools and vehicle repairs, bread, empañadas, food, perfume, chickens, soft drinks and stationery.

loans.use: to invest in groceries, such as eggs, detergent, milk, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Teressa

texts.en: Teressa is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old. Teressa is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Teressa owns and operates a banana production business. Teressa has been in her business for 6 years and earns 20,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Teressa joined GDMPC. Teressa is requesting a new loan of 17,300 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grow. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a wheelbarrow, manure and bush knives.

loans.name: Vaai

texts.en:
Vaai is 38 years old and married with four children.
 
She has a small garden where she grows bananas, taro and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Vaai needs a loan to purchase a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, gloves and safety boots.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Vaai will use the profits from her sales to improve their homes and help with the kids' education.

loans.use: to purchase a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is a married woman who has three children. She is 42 years old, and resides at Kapatagan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Merlinda plants, harvests and sells rice for a living and she's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2010, Merlinda joined GDMPC. In the future, Merlinda wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings &and young crops to raise

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 42-year-old resident of Maloro, Tangub City. With the help of her husband, Mercy has produced bananas for about 5 years now and this has become their main source of income. She and her husband have to persevere still even at an older age in order to provide a good education for their 3 children. She usually earns 3,000 PHP a month. Mercy joined GDMPC in 2010. As for the moment, she is borrowing an amount of 4,700 PHP from GDMPC microfinance to purchase fertilizer. Mercy hopes to improve the business someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: El Manantial Group

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer trabajadora, tiene la edad de 44 años felizmente vive casada con Ramón quien es transportista de una taxi local en el municipio de Ayutla de los libres Gro. Solo tienen 2 hijos pero ya están casados y tiene una pequeña nieta de 2 años  a su responsabilidad.

Blanca es comerciante la cual tiene un negocio donde vende ropa de la marca Ilusión y Calzado de la marca Mega Shoes en este negocio lleva a cerca de 5 años , por lo tanto piensa seguir teniendo ese puesto por que le conviene y está satisfecha de sus ganancias y tiene buena comunicación con sus clientes que le beneficia demasiado llevarse bien con ellos, piensa seguir surtiendo su negocio de zapatos y ropa, pero tambien invertirá su préstamo en  mercancía como son productos de Abarrotes leche, huevos, detergente, jugos, refrescos.
Blanca como 9 mujeres más son integrantes del Grupo El Manantial, a continuación  se mencionan: Angelina, Rosa, Cristina, María, Guadalupe, Natividad, Heriberta, Dinasar, Eneida y Blanca quienes se dedican a la venta de: Comida, Refrescos, Carne, Calzado, Ropa y dulces.
texts.en:
Blanca is a hard working woman, 44 years old, happily married to Ramón who delivers packages by neighborhood taxi in the town of Ayutla de los libres, Guerrero. They only have 2 children who are already married but she has responsibility for a little 2 year old granddaughter. 

Blanca is a trader who has a business where she sells the brand name clothing of Ilusión and footwear from the Mega Shoes brand. She has been in this business about 5 years, and therefore intends to continue in her store because it suits her and she is satisfied with her earnings and she has a good relationship with her customers, as it benefits her to try hard to please them. She intends to continue supplying her business with shoes and clothing, but also she will invest the money from the loan in merchandise such as grocery items like milk, eggs, detergent, juice, and soft drinks.

Blanca and nine more women are in the group of El Manantial, and to continue naming them: Angelina, Rosa, Cristina, María, Guadalupe, Natividad, Heiberta, Dinasar, Eneida and Blanca whose business is selling food, soft drinks, meat, shoes, clothing and sweets.

loans.use: to invest in more merchandise such as clothing and grocery items

loans.name: Aigamanu

texts.en: Aigamanu is a 29-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells pork buns and pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Aigamanu needs a loan to buy flour, soy sauce, onions and oil. She plans to use her profits to help with her kids' education. Aigamanu has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy flour, soy sauce, garlic, onions and oil

loans.name: Fiapapalagi

texts.en:
Fiapapalagi is a 26-year-old married woman with two children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Fiapapalagi has requested a loan to buy a rake, safety boots, a wheelbarrow and a spade and to help with her kids' education.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Fiapapalagi hopes to improve her home and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a rake, safety boots, a wheelbarrow and a spade

loans.name: Toe

texts.en: Toe is a 29-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Toe needs a loan to buy flour, salt, meat and oil. She plans to use her profits to help with her kids' education. Toe has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, meat, and oil

loans.name: Marìa Magdalena

texts.es:
María es una mujer de  34 años de edad, casada, con 0 3 hijos dependientes, Vive en casa propia,  vive en la zona rural del distrito de Morrope,   cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.
La actividad que desarrolla María  es la venta de crianza y  comercialización  de animales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.   
El monto solicitado del crédito es de 1000 nuevos soles y  será para invertir en la compra de aves menores, cerdos y  alimento balanceado.  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización. Cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de  labores agrícolas realizadas por el cónyuge
texts.en:
María, age 34, is married and has three dependent children.  She lives in her own house in the rural area of the Morrope district.  She does have water and electrical services.  It is a small community with approximately 100 families.

María raises and sells animals.  She has been doing this business activity for ten years.  Her business is located at her house.  She learned this business activity from her parents, which is to say she that she has a perfect understanding of this line of work. 

The requested loan for 1,000 soles is to buy poultry, pigs, and balanced feed.  This business has competition, but it also has an ample market.

She does have additional income, which is from her husband’s agricultural work.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed to fatten them.

location.town: Anexo La Zorra - Caserío Arbolsol - Morrope - Lamb

loans.name: Pisi

texts.en: Pisi is 50 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling chips in her community and has been doing this for two years. Pisi has requested a loan to buy oil, plastic bags, taro and banana. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Pisi will improve her home and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy oil, plastic bags, taro and bananas

loans.name: Las Sirenitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Las sirenitas esta conformado por nueve personas trabajadoras e indígenas con el deseo de engrandecer su negocio.
Los integrantes de este grupo son originarios de pinotepa nacional Oaxaca  para ellos su localidad es tierra de progreso.
Lo que caracteriza a pinotepa  son sus chilenas y su comida.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo se llama Inés  una señora trabajadora  muy alegre y platicadora.
Doña Inés  se dedica a la venta de colchas, cosméticos y perfumes desde hace seis años, nos dice que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es salir a vender su mercancía en las colonias de su comunidad.
Lo que no le gusta de su negocio en ocasiones se atrasan sus pedidos por falta de dinero pero  doña Inés siempre trata de tenerlos a tiempo.
Doña Inés es madre soltera pero gracias  a dios doña Inés a sacado a sus hijos adelante  siempre trata de darle una mejor educación.
Uno de los sueños de doña Inés es seguir con su negocio y con el tiempo engrandecerlo un poco más.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para la compra de más colchas, perfumes, cosmeticos para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo.
Esta muy agradecida con fundacion por apoyarla  para que pueda cumplir sus sueños  y darle una mejor vida sus hijos.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
Moisés- se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Elvira Ofelia - se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Maria de Jesús – se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Rosaelia- se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Janet Nayely- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Juana  Catalina – se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Ana Martha- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Rita Mayra- se dedica a la venta  de bordados.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudarles a que sus vidas mejoren cada día mas y así y por apoyar a las madres solteras.
texts.en:
The group called Las Sirenitas is made up of nine indigenous working people who want to grow their businesses.  The members of the group are from the municipality of Pinotepa Nacional in Oaxaca, and they live in the town of Tierra de Progreso.  The character of Pinotepa is seen in their traditional dances, called chilenas, and their food.

One of the group members is named Inés, she is a hard-working woman, who is very happy and chatty.  Inés has worked in the sales of blankets, cosmetics, and perfume for more than six years.  She tells us that what she likes best about the job is going to sell her goods out in the different neighborhoods of her community.  What's not so likeable about her job are the occasions when she falls behind in filling her orders because of a lack of money, but she always tries to have them done on time anyhow.

Inés is a single mother, but, thanks to God, Inés has always been able to give her children a good start in life and always tries to give them a better education.  One of Inés' dreams is to keep herself in business and, in time, to grow it a little bit.

She asked for this loan in order to buy more blankets, perfumes, and cosmetics for sales to customers in wholesales and for personal use.  She is very thankful to the foundation for supporting her to achieve her dreams and give a better life to her children.

The other group members are:
Moisés – works selling perfumes.
Elvira Ofelia – works in clothing sales.
Maria de Jesús – works selling perfumes.
Rosaelia – sells fruits and legumes.
Janet Nayely – works in food sales.
Juana  Catalina – works in clothing sales.
Ana Martha – makes and sells Mexican appetizers.
Rita Mayra – makes and sells embroidered goods.

They thank the foundation for helping them so that they can improve their daily lives and also for its support of single mothers.

loans.use: to buy linens, perfumes, and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Naotala

texts.en: Naotala is 42 years old and married with six children. She makes and sells table mats, baskets, fans, etc to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Naotala has requested a loan to buy pandanus and jewelry. She plans to use her profits to expand and improve her home. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy pandanus and other jewelry

loans.name: Faapaia

texts.en:
Faapaia is a 47-year-old married woman with seven children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Faapaia has requested a loan to buy manure, fertilizer, a spade, a rake, safety boots and gloves). 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Faapaia hopes to help out with her grandchildren's school
"

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, a spade,a rake, safety boots and gloves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, salt, meat, and oil

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer  de 41 años de edad, casada y sin hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo, la casa está ubicada en el caserío Cruce de Vega del  Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte  rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad que desarrolla Margarita es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino, porcino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño exacto los comercializa en el mercado local. Complementariamente se dedica a la agricultura labor compartida con su esposo, pues tienen 2.0 ha de terreno agrícola en donde siembran cultivos transitorios; actualmente tienen sembrado maíz.
El monto solicitado  del crédito es de 3500 nuevos soles y  será para la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado, así como la  compra de fertilizantes para su  cultivo de maíz.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 41 year-old woman, married and without children in her care.  She lives in her own home with her husband, and the house is located in the Cruce de Vega neighborhood of the District of Tambogrande.  She lives in the rural part of the district, but her area does have electricity.  

The activity that Margarita participates in is the raising of small livestock (sheep, pigs, and caged birds). When the animals gain weight and reach an exact weight she sells them in the local market.  At the same time she works in agriculture along with her husband, since they have 2.0 hectares of agricultural land where they plant rotating crops.  Currently they have planted corn.  

The loan amount requested is 3500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) and it will be used for purchasing balanced nutrition for the livestock, as well as for the purchase of fertilizers for the raising of corn.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Adilyakhon

texts.ru: Адиляхон жительница района Джиликул. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Адиляхон при доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 25 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Adilyakhon is a resident of the Jililkul region. She is 44 years old, married and has two children. Adilyakhon has a plot of land by her house where she grows vegetables. She has been in this business for 25 years. She is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Via

texts.en: Via is 52 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling barbeque in her community and has been doing this for two years. Via has requested a loan to buy chicken, sausage, soy sauce, garlic, onions and tomato sauce. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Via will help her kids and improve their home.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sausage, soy sauce, garlic, onions and tomato sauce

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: Maria Azucena, es una mujer con metas a futuro, puesto que su mayor anhelo es llegar a concluir la construccion de su vivienda. Azucena ya hace 4 años aproximadamente que se dedica a la venta de productos omnilife, lacteos. Junto con su esposo han podido lograr objetivos que se han forjado. Agradece a la micro-financiera que una vez mas le ha concedido ser sujeta de un credito, mismo que le permitira la construccion del muro perimetral lado este de su vivienda. Con el que obtendra seguridad y a su vez privacidad para los suyos. Para llevar a cabo el proyecto planeado en esta ocasión requerira comprar: piedras, hierro, estribos, bloques, alambre de amarre, piedrin, cemento, arena entre otros. Siendo para ella esta nueva oportunidad de credito un logro mas y asi ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones. Sus propositos a largo plazo es seguir haciendole mejoras a su hogar e instalar servicios higienicos que es de vital importancia para la salud de los que le rodean.
texts.en:
Maria Azucena is a woman with future goals and her greatest desire is to finish building her home. Approximately four years ago, Azucena started selling Omnilife and dairy products. She and her husband together have been able to achieve the goals they set for themselves. Thanks to micro-financing, she can  once again apply for a loan, this time to construct a perimeter wall on the eastern side of her house. The wall will provide security as well as privacy for her family. 

On this occasion, in order to carry out this project,  Azucdena will need to buy stone, iron, braces, blocks, wire, gravel, cement and sand among other items. This new opportunity to obtain credit is a further accomplishment for her since she will be able to provide her family with better living conditions. Her long term goals are to continue making improvements to her home and to install hygienic services which are of vital importance for the health of those living with her.

loans.use: to construct a perimeter wall around her house.

loans.name: Nazar

texts.ru: Назар проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него 7 детей. Его дети находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Он сам занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается 13 лет. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Nazar lives in the region of Shahrituz. He is 49 years old, married and has seven children. His children are now working in the Russian Federation. He does animal husbandry and has been in this business for thirteen years. He is taking out the loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 44-year-old married woman with five children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Anna has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, a rake, bush knives and a wheelbarrow.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Anna hopes to improve her home and help with her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a rake, bush knives and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru:
Венере 37 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Венера с 2002 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 20,000 сом (KGS), которая была использована для покупки дойной коровы. В хозяйстве Венеры на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 коровы, 1 теленок, 1 лошадь и 20 овец, а  также - 2,0 га орошаемой земли, где она выращивает картофель и фасоль.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Венера обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дойной коровы.  Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Venera is 37 years old, she is married and raising four children. Venera is engaged in animal husbandry and field crop cultivation since 2000 as an additional source income for her family, a business which she started with the capital of 20,000 som (KGS) which was used to buy a milk cow. Today Venera's livestock includes two cows, one calf, one horse and twenty sheep as well as 2,0 hectares of arable land where she grows potatoes and beans.

With the goal to further grow her business Venera has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS to buy a milk cow. She plans to invest the income from the loan to further increase of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Luna Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Luna  esta conformado  por diez  mujeres trabajadoras  y humildes con deseos e ilusiones de hacer que su negocio crezca cada día más.
Todas las integrantes del grupo son originarias de pinotepa nacional tierra  de gente humilde y de progreso.
Una de los bailes de pinotepa nacional son las chilenas.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Adriana Kukene de  treinta tres años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una señora amable y trabajadora.
Doña Adriana como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo se dedica a prestar servicio de taxi desde hace cuatro años.
Ella nos dice que es maestra  de Danza  desde hace siete años, va a dar  clases en las escuelas  y también da clases particulares  a los niños.
Nos dice que esta muy contenta ya que   esta en un proyecto de  deportes donde da clases de  danza en las colonias de su comunidad.
Doña Adriana nos dice que los que más le gusta de su negocio  es enseñar a sus alumnos a bailar y que disfruten el baile.
Una  de sus metas con su negocio es que ha podido escalar ya que hasta horita da clases en los bachilleratos de su comunidad.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio son las tablas rítmicas ya que es lo que más disfruta  por que hace muchas  pirámides.
Algunos retos que la enfrenta para  nos seguir con su negocio es que en acciones no la contratan y eso la hace sentir triste.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más refacciones para su taxi y así poder seguir dando servicios.
También con el crédito desea adquirir otro bien ya que desea vender ropa para niño, niña, dama y caballero.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son: 
Maria Elizabeth- quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos.
Iris Flor- se dedica a la venta de  perfumes.
Maria Guadalupe Monica -se dedica a la venta de dulces.
Emit- se dedica a la venta de artículos de  piel.
Jazmín Lucero- se dedica a la venta de papelería.
Fadia Olivia- se dedica a la  venta de mercería.
Rosa Erica- se dedica a la venta de dulces.
Silvia- se dedica a la venta de dulces.
Ana- se dedica a la venta de dulces.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por apoyarlas para que su  puedan seguir con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Luna communal bank is comprised of ten hard-working and humble women.  They have hopes and dreams of making their businesses grow more each day.  All of the members of the group are from Pinotepa Nacional, land of humble people and advancement.  One of the dances from Pinotepa Nacional is the chilenas.

Adriana Kukene, age 33, is one of the members.  She is known for being a kind and hard-working woman.  Adriana, as she is better known among her group of colleagues, has been providing taxi service for four years.

She tells us that she has been a dance teacher for seven years.  She gives classes in the schools, and she also gives private lessons.  She tells us that she is very happy that she is in this recreational activity where she gives dance classes in the neighborhoods of her community.

Adriana tells us that what she likes the most about her business is teaching her students to dance and that they enjoy dancing.  One of her goals with her business was to expand.  So far she has been able to give classes in the high schools in her community.

The things she really likes about her business are the gymnastic routines set to music.  She enjoys them the most because they make a lot of human pyramids.

One of the challenges that she faces is the continuation of her business.  On the occasions when she is not hired, she feels sad.

She asked for the loan to buy more spare parts for her taxi.  This way she will be able to continue providing service.  She also wants to use the loan to get other goods because she wants to sell clothing for children and adults.

The other members of the group are:

Maria Elizabeth- sells shoes.
Iris Flor- sells perfume.
Maria Guadalupe Monica – sells sweets.
Emit- sells leather goods.
Jazmín Lucero- sells paper.
Fadia Olivia- sells notions.
Rosa Erica- sells sweets.
Silvia- sells sweets.
Ana- sells sweets.

They thank the Fundacion for supporting them so that they are able to continue with their businesses and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her taxi.

loans.name: Valeria Nataly

texts.es:
VALERIA NATALY tiene 19 años de edad es soltera tine un hijo, vive con la mamá y con el hijo de 1 año de edad en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Valeria se dedica a la venta de productos en una bisutería cómo brasaletes, argollas, labiales, peinillas,  y a la venta de botellones de agua. 

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar mercadería como medallones, pulseras, labiales, cosméticos.

Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar la mercadería que tanta falta le hacía. Las compras y las ventas lo hará en ventanas. El sueño es poder comprar una moto.

Los desafíos a los que se presenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir y estudiar.
texts.en:
Valeria Nataly, age 19, is single and has one child.  She lives with her mother and her one year old son in Ventanas in the Ríos province.

Valerie sells costume jewelry like bracelets and rings.  She also sells lipstick, combs, and jugs of water.

She is requesting the loan to be able to buy merchandise like medallions, bracelets, lipstick, and cosmetics.  With the money from the loan she will be able to buy the merchandise that she needs so much.  She will make her purchases and her sales in Ventanas.

Her dream is to be able to buy a motorcycle.

The challenge that presents itself is the competition.  

In her free time she likes to go out and to study.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like medallions, bracelets, lipstick, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Pablo Roberto

texts.es: El emprendedor Pablo Roberto tiene su negocio desde hace doce años  que es  servicio de trasporte en el traslado de arroz,  el inicio su negocio como una alternativa de de trabajo como chofer de los camiones, en la actualidad gracias al apoyo que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado pudo  cumplir su sueños de comprar su propia unidad de trasporte, el está solicitando el crédito para mejorar el piso de su casa. Necesita comprar materiales como: ladrillos, cemento, cal, clavos, arena entre otros.
texts.en: The entrepreneur Pablo Roberto has had his business for two years which is a transport service for the movement of rice. He began his business as an alternative to working as a truck driver. Currently thanks to the help of the Fundación León 2000, he has been able to fulfill his dreams of buying his own vehicle. He is asking for a loan in order to improve the floor in his home. He needs to buy supplies such as bricks, cement, lime, nails, sand, and other items.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, lime, nails, sand and other items

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos pequeños; sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos, ella vende papa deshidratada como chuño, moraya, también trigo, cebada, quinua, maíz etc. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo quien  tienen un negocio de venta de vasos y platos descartables, de forma ambulatoria, y por medio de estos negocios los esposos sacan adelante a sus hijos.
 
Francisca quiere ampliar sus negocios y solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería, (Alimentos Secos) percibir mayores ingresos y poder formalizar su negocio, y poner una tienda de artículos de plástico, negocio que ellos quieren hacer crecer.

La señora Francisca pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; que está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca is 32 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three small children. Her daily activities include managing her business of selling dried products. She sells dehydrated potatoes, such as "chuño" and "moraya", but she also sells wheat, barley, quinoa, corn, and other products. Francisca also works with her husband, who has a business of selling disposable glasses and plates as a street vendor. Through these businesses, Francisca and her husband are able to help their children get ahead.

She wants to expand her businesses, so she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise (dried foods) so that she can generate more income and formalize her business. Francisca also plans to open a plastic goods store, a business that she and her husband would like to see grow.

Sra. Francisca is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Triunfadoras" (The Winners), which is located in the District of Andahuaylillas, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy dried foods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Los Mangos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama los mangos esta conformado por  nueve mujeres trabajadoras y alegres que se dedican diversas actividades económicas.
Todas son originarias de un pequeño pueblo llamado los tres ríos o mejor conocido como la nueva esperanza  es un lugar hermosos donde hay muchos árboles y esta un rió que  se divide en tres ríos grandes.
Una de las tradiciones de la comunidad es que celebran el día de muertos ponen sus ofrendas y ya los niños van con sus canastas a pedir ofrendas.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Fortunata Teresa  de cuarenta y tres  años de edad se dedica a la  dar servicios de su molino donde muele la  nixtamal  también se dedica a la siembra de chiles desde hace siete años.
Doña Fortunata  como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo nos dice que  en las mañanas viene sus clientas a moler y en las tardes también ya que solamente  muele dos veces al día.
Lo que mas le gusta  su negocio del molino es molerles el  nixtamal a sus clientas y darles una buena atención y lo que mas le gusta de la siembra de chile es  sembrarlos  y cosecharlo.
Una de las cosas que le impiden seguir con su negocio del molino es que en ocasiones el molino no quiere moler el nixtamal  y sus clientas se desesperan ya que el molino esta un poquito  viejo.
Doña Fortunata pidió el préstamo para la compra de más líquidos  para las siembras y compra de piedras para su molino.
Doña Fortunata  esta felizmente casada con el señor  Seferino de cincuenta años de edad con quien tiene  dos hijos  Rufino y Florinda a quienes quiere mucho.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por apoyarla para que su negocio crezca cada día más  y puedan tener una mejor vida.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Carmela- quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Minerva- se dedica a la  venta de manualidades.
Ausencia- se dedica a la venta de frutas.
Anayeli – se dedica a la venta de antojitos.
Alejandrina Paula - se dedica a la venta de queso.
Mónica- se dedica a brindar  servicios de estilista.
Liliana – se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Romana- se dedica a la venta de pan.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudarle a que su vida mejore y así puedan darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Los Mangos Group is comprised of nine happy, hard-working women who are engaged in various business activities.  They are all from a small town called “Los Tres Ríos” (The Three Rivers) or better known as the “La Nueva Esperanza” (The New Hope).  It is a beautiful place where there are many trees and a main river that is divided into three large rivers. The community celebrates El Día de Muertos” (The Day of the Dead), a tradition where people honor the dead with offerings and the children go out with their baskets asking for offerings.

One of the members of this group is Señora Fortunata Teresa.  She is 43 years old. She provides the services of her mill, where she grinds corn.  She has also been growing chili peppers for the past seven years.  Doña Fortunata, as she is better known by her companions in the group, tells us that her customers come to grind corn in the mornings and the evenings because she only grinds twice a day.  

What she likes most about her mill business is grinding the corn for her customers and giving them good service, and what she likes most about growing the chili peppers is planting and harvesting.  One of the things that prevent her from continuing her mill business is that sometimes the mill doesn’t want to grind the corn and her customers despair because the mill is a little old.

Doña Fortunata is requesting the loan to purchase more liquid fertilizer for planting and to purchase stones for her mill.  She is happily married to Señor Seferino who is 50 years old.  They have two children, Rufino and Florinda, who they love very much. She thanks the foundation for supporting her so that her business grows more each day enabling them to have a better life.

The other members of the group are as follows:
Carmela who sells chickens 
Minerva who sells handicrafts 
Ausencia who sells fruit
Anayeli who sells snacks
Alejandrina Paula who sells cheese
Mónica who provides hair styling services
Liliana who sells groceries
Romana who sells bread

They are thankful to the foundation for helping them improve their lives and so enabling them to provide their children with a better life.

loans.use: to purchase liquid fertilzer for chili pepper planting.

loans.name: Abigail Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Abigail esta conformado once integrantes mujeres trabajadoras  y humildes.
Los integrantes de este grupo trabajan en tienda llamada Gazher donde hay varios departamentos ya que hay farmacia, abarrotes, regalos, salchiconeria, plasticos, cristaleria y verdulería.
Todos trabajan  el diferentes puestos  ya que algunos  de estos integrantes trabajan en contabilidad  pero todos se quieren mucho no importa el departamento donde trabajen.
No todo son originarios de pinotepa  son de pueblos  muy pequeños pero  vinieron a  pinotepa a trabajar  para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Para ellos pinotepa es  tierra de progreso y superación ya que cuenta con fundacion Realidad  quien les esta ayudando para que su vidas mejoren.
Uno de los integrantes es el contador  Isaac Heriberto quien se encarga de la contabilidad en la  tienda Gazher  pero gracias  a fundacion tiene su  pequeño negocio se dedica a la venta de comida.
El nos dice que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es  cocinar ya que  vende en las noches lo que son: tacos dorados, enchiladas, empanadas, sopes y tortas.
Este muy contento por el apoyo que le ha dado fundacion para que su vida mejore ya que su negocio le deja buenas ganancias y así puede  darle una mejor vida a su familia.
Esta felizmente casado con la señora  Yuliana  una señora amable trabajadora , ella nos dice que esta muy contenta por el apoyo que le ha dado  su esposo ya que los dos se encargan del negocio  se apoyan uno al otro para poder darle una mejor vida a sus dos hijos.
El Cont. Isaac como mejor lo conocen   sus compañeras de grupo y compañeras de trabajo  nos dice que pidió el préstamo para la compra de  mas ingredientes para la elaboración de  comida como son: chiles verdees tomate.,cebolla,ajo,pollo,carne de res,maiz,queso,aceite y quesillo.
Una de sus dificultades con su negocio es que en ocasiones tiene  mucho trabajo y se le  hace tarde para  llegar a su negocio y ayudar a su esposo para preparar lo que van a vender.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo  que le ha dado para  que pueda tener su propio negocio  y poder trabajar y así generar más empleos.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Minerva- quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Dulce Elia -quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Guadalupe Lucia-quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos.
Ivett- quien se dedica a la venta de agua de garrafón.
Guadalupe- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Marcelina- quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Tomasa  Felicitas-quien se dedica a la venta de artesanías.
Elizabeth-quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Maria de Dolores –quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Angela Reyna- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudarlos a que sus vidas cambien y puedan tener su propio negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias que son lo mas importante.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called "Abigail," is made up of eleven members who are hardworking and humble women. 
The members of this communal bank work in a store called "Gazher."  The store has various departments, for example, pharmacy, grocery, gifts, deli, plastics, glassware, and greengrocer. 
They all work in different positions; some of the members even work in accounting.  But they all care for each other a lot, regardless of the department each works in.
Not all of them members are from Pinotepa originally.  Some are from very small towns, but they came to Pinotepa to work and for a better quality of life.
For them, Pinotepa is a land of progress and improvement.  Having Fundacion Realidad in Pinotepa is helping the women to better their lives. 
One of the members is the bookkeeper Isaac Heriberto, who takes care of Gazher's accounting.  But thanks to Fundacion Realidad, he also has a small business selling food.
He tells us that what he likes most about his business is cooking.  At night he sells crispy, fried tacos, enchiladas, empanadas, sopes and sandwiches (all local fare).
He is very happy about the support Fundacion Realidad has given him.  It has helped him to have a better life.  His business earns him a good profit, and with that profit, he can give his family a better life.
Isaac Heriberto is happily married to Señora Yuliana, a friendly and hardworking woman.  She tells us that she is very happy about the support her husband has been given.  She and her husband both take care of their food business and support one another in giving a better life to their two children.
Bookkeer Isaac, as he is known to the other members of the communal bank and to his co-workers, tells us that he requested the loan to purchase more ingredients for the food he sells, like: green chilies, tomatoes, onion, garlic, chicken, beef, cheese, oil and farmer's cheese.
One of the difficulties with the business is that sometimes Isaac has a lot of work at the store and is late getting home to help his spouse prepare the food for sale.
Isaac is grateful to the Foundation for the support they have given him, which has enabled him to have his own business, to work and to generate more work.
The other members of the group are:
Minerva- who makes her living selling perfume.
Dulce Elia -who makes her living selling perfume.
Guadalupe Lucia-who makes her living selling shoes.
Ivett- who makes her living selling large jugs of water.
Guadalupe- who makes her living selling clothing.
Marcelina- who makes her living selling grocery items.
Tomasa  Felicitas-who makes her living selling handicrafts.
Elizabeth-who makes her living selling grocery items.
Maria de Dolores –who makes her living selling grocery items.
Angela Reyna- who makes her living selling food.
They are all grateful to the Foundation for helping them to change their lives, to be able to have their own businesses and to improve their quality of life and that of their families, who are of greatest importance.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Perosi

texts.en: Perosi is a 41-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Perosi needs a loan to buy flour, soy sauce, oil and garlic onions. She plans to use her profits to improve her home and help with her children's education. Perosi has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy more flour, soy sauce, oil and garlic onions

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 36 años de edad, casada, con 03 hijos dependientes, vive en casa propia en el Caserío Punto 9, fundo El Gañan, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque.
La actividad que realiza Juana  es la  venta de abarrotes en su domicilio como  pollo sacrificado por kilos, y otros. Además  cuenta con clientela fidelizada, .También se dedica a la venta de aves de corral. Adicionalmente clienta trabaja en la fábrica de sal  en el Distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Su Cónyuge  trabaja hace varios años como maestro panadero en Lambayeque lo que le permite tener algunos ingresos adicionales.
El monto solicitado  del crédito es de 4000 nuevos soles y  será para surtir su bodega  y  la compra de alimento balanceado  para sus animales.
texts.en:
Juana is a 36 year-old married woman with three dependent children.  She lives in her own home in the Punto 9 neighborhood of El Gañan, located about 15 minutes from the city of Lambayeque.

Juana works in the selling of groceries out of her house, selling things like sacrificed chickens by the kilo, and other ítems.  In addition, she can count on a faithful clientele.  She also works selling caged birds.  She also works in the salt factory in the District of José Leonardo Ortiz.  Her husband has worked for several years as a master baker in Lambayeque which allows them to have good additional income.  

She requests a loan of 4000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) and it will be used to supply her store and purchase balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to supply her store and purchase balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Soloi

texts.en: Soloi is a 51-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells pancakes and pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. Soloi needs a loan to buy flour, soy sauce, garlic onions, sugar, baking powder and syrup. She plans to use her profits to buy another new oven for her bakery. Soloi has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy flour, soy sauce, garlic onions, sugar, baking powder and syrup

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita is a 45-year-old married woman with three children.
 
She would like to start growing a plantation to earn a living. Makerita has requested a loan for a wheel barrow, a plant sprayer, chemicals, etc. 

She has been a member of SPBD for three years. Makerita will spend her profits to buy more tools used in her business.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a plant sprayer, chemicals, etc

loans.name: Rosalìa

texts.es:
Rosalía es una mujer  de 29 años de edad, soltera, vive en casa de sus  padres ubicada en el cario Santa Isabel del distrito de Mòrrope.
La actividad comercial a la  que se dedica Rosalía es la venta de abarrotes y cuenta con experiencia en este rubro, su bodega  funciona en su domicilio y en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, detergentes, leches, golosinas, etc. Además cuenta con clientes ya establecidos en la zona. Adicionalmente cría y vende animales.
El monto solicitado del crédito es de 1000 nuevos soles, con el crédito comprará mas mercadería para surtir su negocio .atendiendo la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar,  ampliará su cartera de clientes, contando con clientes nuevos e ingresos adicionales a la familia.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a 29-year-old woman who is single and lives at her parents' house in El Cario Santa Isabel in the District of Mòrrope. Her business involves selling groceries and she has experience in this line of work. Rosalía's store is located in her home and the products she sells include basic necessities such as rice, sugar, detergents, milk, candy, and other items. She has established customers from the area. Rosalía also raises and sells animals.

The loan amount she is requesting is 1,000 PEN and will be used to buy more merchandise to restock her business. This will enable her to satisfy the unmet demand in this area, expand her clientele by obtaining new customers, and earn additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru:
